dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: Super: THE KHYBER PASS, AFGHANISTAN We're looking down at what used to be called "The End of World." A landscape that is both beautiful, and forbiddin In the center of this vista, there is a deep ravine. Pushing in on the ravine, there appears to be a giant ici over a cliff: AN ICE FALL. A 600 foot waterfall whose face is frozen so Pushing in still closer, there is a tiny black dot inchin the ice. A human figure. This is: JAMES BOND, BRITISH SECRET SERVICE AGENT, 007. Bond is sweating and straining, four hundred feet in the an ice-pick tethered to each hand, ice-cleats on his boot backpack. As he climbs, spider-like, pulling himself up, JAM A CLEAT into the ice, but - CRACK! A 50 foot stiletto of ice breaks off, CRASHING ont below. Regaining his foothold, Bond looks down: Certain d looks up: So very, very, far to go. Bond shakes his head:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There has to be an easier way to earn a living. Still, Bond climbs. Huffing, sweating, he goes up, and up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's 25 feet from the top. He drives a first ice pick in. toehold. But when he slams the second pick in -

dialogues.speaker: BOND LOSES HIS GRIP ON THE FIRST ICE PICK -
dialogues.text: And 007 is now dangling, 575 feet in the air, staring at water - hanging only by the leather thread around his wri to the first ice-pick, still embedded in the wall. Bond pauses. Thinks. And coolly begins to swing himself b forth, in widening arcs, like a clock's pendulum. At the high point of his swing, Bond reaches back to smas pick into the ice - BUT MISSES. He looks up at:

dialogues.speaker: THE FIRST ICE PICK, STILL EMBEDDED IN THE WALL -
dialogues.text: Beginning to work its way out. The tether, fraying.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN ON BOND -
dialogues.text: Cautiously, 007 begins to swing a second time. Once. Twic the third arc, he swings the ice-pick viciously - but MIS

dialogues.speaker: THE FIRST ICE PICK, STILL EMBEDDED IN THE WALL -
dialogues.text: Now jutting downward, barely holding. The tether is almos frayed through.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN ON BOND -
dialogues.text: One last chance. Bond swings. Once. Twice. He reaches bac himself at the wall, lunging - AND SMASHES THE SECOND PIC ICE... Just as the tether finally snaps on the first one. he's all but home: He reaches over, grabs the first pick holding in the ice,) jabs it in, and continues upward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exhausted, Bond reaches up, over the edge. He drives a pi through the ice, into the hard, flat, ground beneath the As he pulls himself up, (his full weight on the first ice smashes a second pick through the ice, into the waterbed,

dialogues.speaker: THE ENTIRE ICE FALL GIVES WAY -
dialogues.text: Breaking off with a groan, tumbling onto the rocks below.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE WATERBED -
dialogues.text: A torrent of water crashes over 007. Fighting the oncomin he crawls - on his belly - through the water - 25 feet in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond stands, walks out of the riverbed. He looks back at

dialogues.speaker: THE WATER FALL -
dialogues.text: On either side of the water, there are two small RADAR DI down, scanning every inch of the area, save for the water In other words: This was the only way in.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN ON BOND -
dialogues.text: 007 shrugs. From his backpack, he takes out TWO CIGAR-SIZ CANISTERS, and an ELONGATED BLACK BOX. He presses a butto side of the box, and - fwap, fwap, fwap - SNOW SKIS unfol He presses buttons on the canisters: TELESCOPIC SKI POLES slaps on the skis, and takes off, through the snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond hurtles over the side, going airborne, landing 100 f amidst boulders. In perfect Olympic form, he skis out, an

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond slaloms down, in and out of trees, to avoid detectio bottom, where the snow thins, he comes to: A ROCK OUTCROPPING. Hiding behind the rock, Bond takes off his skis, knapsack unpacks (and unfolds) a HIGH TECH AUTOMATIC RIFLE. Puts o HEADSET. He creeps up on the rock, and looks out on:

dialogues.speaker: A SECRET MILITARY BASE/AIR STRIP, (BOND'S POV)
dialogues.text: 50 feet down, 200 yards away: 50 MEN are unloading CARGO MILITARY TRANSPORT TRUCKS; there are TWO NORTH KOREAN MiG ground (one partially obscured by a truck,) plus FLATBEDS HELICOPTERS and SCUD MISSILES. Near a QUONSET HUT, a TRUCK-MOUNTED RADAR DISH scans the INFRARED GATLING GUNS mounted on either side.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Props his rife on the boulder, and peers through the GUN

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE TELESCOPIC SIGHT -
dialogues.text: He sees a closer (but still wide) telescopic view of men over weapons, and forklifts loading/unloading crates of m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over a speaker)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven, in position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger, Seven. Watching this display is M, TANNER, and a handful of MILI including a RUSSIAN GENERAL, BUKHARIN, and BRITISH ADMIRA an aging sea-lion with no love for M, or MI-6. M deals with the humorless Admiral by, well, humoring him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... What were you saying, Admiral? Something about this 'not being a job for a wine-sniffing, skirt-chasing playboy spy?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - I'll be sure to acknowledge 007's 'assistance' in my report to the Prime Minister. But this is, still, a naval operation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do they say in Russia, General Bukharin? (asks questions in flawless Russian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The general chuckles. Translates:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'In a joint operation, someone's nose always gets put out of joint.' M turns to Admiral Roebuck:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm interested in success, Admiral. Not who gets credit. (turning to:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Tanner: What have we got? Tanner points to the video wall with a RED LASER PEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ironically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A regular terrorist swap meet. Death at discount: Two Chinese Long March Scuds, a pair of Soviet A-17 attack helicopters -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stolen -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the crates look like American M-16 assault rifles, Chilean antipersonnel mines, six French Exocet missiles, and 75 - no maybe a hundred - kilograms of Czech made C-4 Semtech explosive. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something for everyone. Fun for the whole family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (freezing him with a glance)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about ID's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pushes a button on a console)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One to seven: Deal the face cards.

dialogues.speaker: THE ROCK OUTCROPPING -
dialogues.text: Bond adjusts a knob on the scope.

dialogues.speaker: MI-6 SITUATION ROOM -
dialogues.text: On the video-screen, the picture zooms to a CLOSE UP of o arms traders. Tanner presses a button, and - almost insta man's bio and vitals appear on another video screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gustav Meinholtz. Neo-Nazi, former East German STASI agent. Ties to the Beider-Meinhoff gang. (pressing a button)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aces high, seven. Bid to the east. Bond shifts his aim, east. (Intercut as necessary) He zer another face, and the man's stats appear in London.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vilko Barkoviac. Bosnian war criminal; thought to be operating freelance out of Teheran. (pressing a button)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full house, seven. Bid to the North. Bond complies. Another face, another set of stats:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitoshi Isagura. Japanese religious fanatic. Wanted for the Tokyo subway -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatiently, cutting him off:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen enough. Let's finish this. (ordering M:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell your man to drop back. We're initiating plan B -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Thank you, M. But this is more than your man can handle. (to Bukharin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we in agreement?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitant, at first)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Yes. Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral - Moving swiftly, the Admiral has picked up a RED PHONE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Command to Nelson: Authorization to fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weapons authorized. Prepare to fire. On my count: Five. Four. Three. Two -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A launcher rotates, and - BOOM - a Cruise missile blasts

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cruise missile away -

dialogues.speaker: MI-6 SITUATION ROOM -
dialogues.text: FIRING OFFICER'S VOICE (Cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to target: Four minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate your assistance, M. But this is now a military operation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urgently, to Tanner)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring up the tracking satellite. And get 007 out of there. Tanner hits a button - and a third video screen appears, satellite view of the area, detailing the Cruise's path a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One to seven: Exit target area. Repeat -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven to one. Negative. Wait.

dialogues.speaker: THE ROCK OUTCROPPING -
dialogues.text: Bond has taken his eye from the scope. He's peering at: THE MIG-29'S - ("MiG-1," AND "MiG-2") - A FORKLIFT appears from behind the TRUCK blocking the vie A TALL BALD MAN is riding the empty fork, with his back t

dialogues.speaker: BOND -
dialogues.text: Puts his eye back on the scope, shifts the rifle -

dialogues.speaker: MI-6/VIDEO WALL -
dialogues.text: Bond's scope view settles on THE BALD MAN. The forklift r back of the truck. HE STEPS OFF as the fork begins rising something. And as the man turns, FACING US to scan the ar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling up his stats)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kim Dae Yung. North Korean Nuclear specialist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning there may be nuclear material down there? Tanner nods. A look passes from M, to Bukharin, to Roebuc

dialogues.speaker: THE CRUISE MISSILE -
dialogues.text: Hugging the surface, crossing from water to land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to target: Three minutes. (sfx: Beep!)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Target acquired. Weapon armed. Tension. Adrenaline. QUIET PANIC. On the SCREEN, the FORK pulled a RED BOX from the truck, a SHORT ROUND MAN appear

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is that?!? What's in the box??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (punching buttons)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. He's not in the database -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bukharin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's in the box, General? (he shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's in the box???

dialogues.speaker: BUKHARIN
dialogues.text: (sheepishly) ... We usually... Transport... Weapons grade uranium. Shock sweeps the room. M turns on Tanner:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will it go off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. Maybe not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abort the cruise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too late -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One to seven - one to seven -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative, one. NOT YET. THE TRUCK/MiG-l, ON THE GROUND/THROUGH THE SCOPE - THE BALD MAN slaps the back of the truck obscuring MiG-1. PULLS AWAY, revealing MiG-l's WING. Hanging from the weap NUCLEAR BOMB.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Mutters a curse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soviet SB-9 nuclear torpedo. Yield, one kiloton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will the cruise set it off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bukharin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. Can't you people keep anything locked up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't know it was missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me the Prime Minister. Alert NATO, the CIA, the Pentagon. (presses a button:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven: This is a direct order. I want you out of there. Do you copy?

dialogues.speaker: THE ROCK OUTCROPPING -
dialogues.text: Bond's headset lies on top of the rock, along with the te sight - still broadcasting. Find Bond, crouching BEHIND the rock. Automatic rifle in GRENADE in the other. He pulls the pin, hurls it 40 feet Pauses. Waits, counting down time. Then - BOND SPRINGS. SHOOTS at one of the CRATES. IT BLOWS UP, j THE GRENADE EXPLODES. There's PANIC ON THE GROUND. Men running everywhere as TH GATLING GUN spins, and SENDS A HAIL OF FIRE at Bond's div And with this, BOND is off, SPRINTING INTO THE CHAOS. THE SAME SCENE - VIDEO SCREEN - MI-6 SITUATION ROOM. Stoned silence. Disbelief. Tanner whispers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God help him.

dialogues.speaker: THE CRUISE MISSILE
dialogues.text: God help the rest of us.

dialogues.speaker: THE SECRET AIR BASE -
dialogues.text: As various factions shoot at each other (Who's the traito streaks toward the action. Without breaking stride, he sw gun to the right: TWO BURSTS. THREE MEN DIE. Still runnin swings to the left: ANOTHER BURST. TWO MORE DOWN. Ahead, Bond sees the FLIGHT CREWS DASHING for the MiG's. beeline for MiG-1.

dialogues.speaker: THE BALD MAN -
dialogues.text: Slamming the gate on the RED BOX in a cargo truck. Rushin passenger door. Climbing in. The SHORT ROUND MAN floors t accelerator, driving them away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to target: Thirty seconds. WIDE ON MiG-1 - The pilot climbs the ladder to the cockpit. Running at fu BOND LEAPS, pulls the man down. They fall to the tarmac, Bond SHOVES A KNIFE in the man's ribs, killing him. Kneeling, Bond takes the pilot's helmet off. He looks up: coming at him with a GUN. In one unbroken move, Bond YANK from the pilot's body and THROWS IT - thwack - into the m ANGLE ON MIG-2'S PILOT - WATCHING THIS FROM HIS COCKPIT.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN ON BOND
dialogues.text: Where the COPILOT (having climbed in from the other side, not the right guy. As he fumbles for a weapon, BOND BASHE THE HELMET. The copilot collapses into his seat, unconsci Bond settles into his seat, fires the engines, closes the canopy, and begins taxiing out.

dialogues.speaker: THE RUNWAY -
dialogues.text: The CRUISE SKIMS IN DIRECTLY OVER BOND'S PLANE, speeding (INT. BOND'S MiG) BOND SHOVES THE THROTTLES TO THE FIREBA

dialogues.speaker: THE VIDEO-WALL
dialogues.text: KA-BOOM!!!! The scene on the screen erupts in a GIANT EXP then turns to video-snow. Is Bond alive? No one in London

dialogues.speaker: THE AIR BASE -
dialogues.text: The FIREBALL grows and grows, a raging hell. And just whe no one could possibly survive: BOND'S MiG ROCKETS OUT OF INT. BOND'S MiG - Bond thinks he's safe. Sound. Until - MiG-2 FLIES OUT OF THE FIREBALL - Cannons blazing at 007. A hail of metal and tracers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond goes into evasive maneuvers - jinks right, jinks lef suddenly, THE COPILOT REVIVES, and starts trying to STRAN with a METAL LANYARD. Struggling, Bond HEARS a THIN HIGH-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pilot has locked onto Bond's MiG. Boom! TWO HEAT-SEEK MISSILES roar away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fighting the garrote, Bond KICKS THE THROTTLES forward an ON THE YOKE. The MiG goes into a spine crushing climb as THE TWO HEAT SEEKING MISSILES FOLLOW HIM, LOOPING UPWARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond's MiG has disappeared from the pilot's view: Not in on the left. Not on the right. Where did he go? The pilot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fighting against the garrote, Bond strains to reach a RED the panel: COPILOT EJECTOR SEAT. Bond finally taps it, and - THE BACK HALF OF THE CANOPY B The COPILOT BLASTS OUT OF THE PLANE, DOWNWARD, directly i cockpit. Bond peels off. For a second, MiG-2 hangs in the air. Until... BOOM!!! Th SEEKING MISSILES BLAST IT TO SMITHEREENS. Back in MiG-1, Bond fiddles with the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven to base. I have a full house. Your bid. The situation room erupts in cheers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way: Thank the General for all his "assistance." Over and out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goes to AFTERBURNERS. And from the fiery glow of the engi

dialogues.speaker: THE 007 GUN BARREL. MAIN CREDITS.
dialogues.text: After credits, fade in on:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All ivy and bricks... And a certain Aston-Martin DB-5, pa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Afterglow: Empty champagne bottle. Rumpled sheets on a sl Bond is in bed with a smart, IRONIC, (and, yes, stunning, Chinese woman, JENNY WU. (NOTE: The Chinese here is Manda phonetically.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (running a finger across her lips)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And what do you call these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ja-shwa tsway. These are lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed they are. (kisses them, lightly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deadly little things. She laughs. His hand goes beneath the sheets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what do you call these? The Gang of Two?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smacking his hand, laughing:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just getting to the interesting part!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've already done the interesting part. Do you forget?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remind me. He moves to roll on top of her, but she pushes him off, t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sakwa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that Mandarin, or Cantonese?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mandarin. You jerk. (tousling his hair)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm late. I have to get dressed. She hops off the bed, leaving frame. Bond settles back on headboard, ready to enjoy the view... When his CELL PHONE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lightly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello - (catching himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. INT. M'S ANTEROOM - MI-6. MONEYPENNY, at her desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, James. I hope I'm interrupting something important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Jenny has a leg on the bed, pulling on a full Victoria's outfit: Nylons, garter/suspenders, bustier, etc.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all, Moneypenny. I was just brushing up on a little Chinese. (In the background, Jenny insists "I am not little.")

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure she is, James. But I'm afraid you'll have to 'kiss off' the rest of your lessons this afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mock chagrin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moneypenny... Here I was, finally getting a feel for a new tongue -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four o'clock. M will meet you in the conference room. Bond watches with amusement as Jenny Wu slips a Graduatio over the lingerie. No dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4:30. It may take me a little longer to wrap things up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four o'clock. Don't be late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hanging up:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tsi tien, Chien-penny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, James. You always were a cunning linguist... Au revoir, mon cher. Moneypenny hangs up, looks up, and blanches: M is standin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell. (walking away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond and Jenny Wu emerge from the office. (She's still in They pass a flock of young students:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good afternoon, Professor Wu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good afternoon. (then to Bond)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you can't stay for the lecture?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. But I did enjoy the dress rehearsal. She gives him a wry glance, opens a door to a lecture hal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tsi tien, Mr. Bond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tsi tien, Professor Wu. She exits; Bond walks off, passing underneath a WALL MOUN ON THE TV SET - The HNN Globe Logo - The Harmsway News Ne spins into view, followed by:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're watching HNN, the Harmsway 24 hour news network. Coming up: (mortise shot of:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentin Zukofsky's stunning victory in the Ukrainian Presidential elections... (mortise shot of:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Live coverage of the latest HNN communications satellite launch from Xichang (shi-chung) China... And - (mortise shot of:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A special report on the situation in Hong Kong, since the Chinese take- over from Great Britain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DB-5 drives past the guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debriefing: Bond, M, and several others listen as NATO CO DOMINIQUE EVERHART, (early 30's, Belgian,) refers to vide the Khyber Pass sequence:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To sum up: After analyzing the tire inflation of the fork-lift in the MI-6 video tape, NATO believes the "red box contains approximately eighty kilograms of U235 weapons grade uranium - an incredibly hard, incredibly heavy, incredibly lethal substance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's enough enriched uranium to produce how many nuclear devices?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depending on the builder's sophistication - one crude bomb that could devastate London, Paris, New York, Berlin - or all four if they have the latest technology. There's a pregnant pause in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the participants?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing at the screen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kim Dae Yung. Moscow-trained North Korean nuclear weapons specialist; apparently fell out of favor with the current North Korean regime after a botched attempt to steal fissionable material from a British light-water reactor in South Africa - an accident that left him entirely hairless... Another face appears on the screen: COL. DOMINIQUE EVERHART (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Rendera Sikrahm, also known as Richard Stamper. Freelance mercenary, Laos and Cambodia. His father was from Nepal - a Ghurka warrior - con- scripted by the British government to fight in China during World War II - after which the family settled in Hong Kong, where the young Stamper was undoubtedly treated like a second class citizen by both the Hong Kong Chinese, and local British. (beat, aside:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've all read about the signs at the British swimming pools in Hong Kong that said "No Ghurka's allowed."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing like a little imperialism to promote loyalty among the faithful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stifles a smile, then:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In conclusion: Both these men have a vendetta against the world. They are nuclear armed, and dangerous. And having failed to get the UZ35 through the old opium route - the Khyber Pass - it's NATO's belief that their next attempt will be through Bulgaria - where the NATO Nuclear Strike Force will be there to stop them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you Colonel Everhart. (stands, turns to:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 007, I'd like to see you in my office. Why don't you and the Colonel exchange numbers if you need more information?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, M. M exits. Bond approaches Dominique. She smiles, warmly. T mutual attraction - but there's something else going on,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interesting presentation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interesting video tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They point, I shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feels her pockets)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a pen? I just got promoted and don't have my new cards yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Bond hands her a PEN. She regards it cautiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Does this do anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends what number you write. She gives him a wry look; starts to write. He notes her W

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three. You? Married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think so. For an instant, something crosses Bond's face: Bitterswee morse? Either way, she's scored a subtle victory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. I gave you my assistant's phone number. If it's urgent, she knows where to reach me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. (beat, holding her gaze)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take care -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too. With a Sphinx-like smile, she watches Bond leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Bond encounters MONEYPENNY, also walking to M's off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moneypenny! We've got to stop meeting like this. They may be on to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, James. Enjoy your meeting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the darkest moments, it's what I live for. Especially since I've heard how much you like to watch... On the hidden camera. Moneypenny cuts Bond a look - and, in the background, see leave the conference room, and walk down the hall, away f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, James: Ordinarily I would never ask, but... Weren't you and that Colonel once stranded on a raft for two weeks in the Sargasso Sea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moneypenny! How indiscreet! Have you ever known me to kiss and tell? They've come to a security door. She punches in a code -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I've never known you to do either... But -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - We all want what we can't have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not all of us, 007. The door opens. They go into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What - no lust for adventure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, 007. It's just that I've learned from personal experience - that when we get what we want - (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somehow the reality is never as... Satisfying as the fantasy. Bond scowls. Moneypenny smiles wryly, points to the inner

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't keep M waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M is behind her desk; MINISTER PETER JOHNSTONE sits acros handed Teflon-coated politician, with the survival instin plutonium. They've been arguing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in, 007. You know the Minister?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. (nods to)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Minister Johnstone.
Bond sits in an armchair. M presses a button, and a video ELIOT HARMSWAY appears on the wall behind her. Mid-50's,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, 007, what do you know about Elliot Harmsway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quipping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only what I read in the newspapers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disdainfully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His newspapers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing sideways)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Occasionally, yes. (directly to M)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: British media mogul. Born in Hong Kong; controls newspapers, TV, radio, cable, satellites; books, magazines, movies, computer software. Theme parks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding up a copy of:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Along with Tomorrow - the first world-wide newspaper. Circulation 27 million. Daily. -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Able to topple governments with a single story' - as he says in his press.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hurrumph)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. Bond looks at Johnstone quizzically. Then a very tight-li senses he's about to enter a minefield:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... What's Harmsway done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems, 007, we've received a tip

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rumor - from an anonymous source -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - that Sir Elliot may be involved with Stamper and Yung, and the missing Uranium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearsay. Idle chatter from a source you can't identify - who insists on talking only to 007. Nothing but loose talk and innuendo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That may be the case at present, Minister Johnstone... But our own sources suspect that Mr. Harmsway used his considerable Russian media - holdings to elect Valentin Zukofsky President of the Ukraine - in trade for the uranium. (M has punched a button, and Valentin's video bio has app

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More scurrilous, unsubstantiated gossip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps. But it does explain how an ex-KGB agent turned illegal-arms dealer is suddenly portrayed as a long-time friend of the people. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you believe what you read in the papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need I remind the two of you that Elliot Harmsway - Sir Elliot Harmsway - is directly descended from the Earl of Aberdeen? That his Scottish ancestors practically invented Hong Kong - and out of sheer gratitude, Queen Victoria herself named the port "Aberdeen Harbor" in their honor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (long pause, then:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... No more than I need remind you, Minister, that merely being a member of the lucky sperm club - does not preclude one from a life of criminal activity. Johnstone is reeling. M continues, to Bond, with aplomb:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reason I invited the Minister here, 007, was to reassure him that this investigation will be handled with the utmost discretion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is also why I've withheld this information from NATO and our allies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods, then, recalling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Didn't we once investigate Harmsway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. 1988. He was furious at the British plan to return Hong Kong, and supposedly started his own negotiations with the Chinese Government. The inquiry went nowhere - but it did earn MI-6 a rather powerful enemy -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to mention the chaos it caused at Whitehall when his newspapers began screaming for the recall of the sitting government.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat, then:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sending you to Venice, 007. You're to check out the source, determine whether Elliot Harmsway is involved with the enriched uranium, and, if so, stop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How will I meet the informant? She hands Bond a CARNIVAL MASK:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're to wear this mask at the Venice Carnival, and wait to be contacted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (standing, to leave)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is one last thing, 007: Elliot Harmsway is vital to the economic interests of this nation. He's also a major contributor to the party. I expect him to be given every consideration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Political considerations?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the best of my recollection, Mr. Bond, I suggested no such thing. (beat, at the door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fact, I was never here. And he exits. M, frowning, hits a button on her intercom:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you send in the new man from equipment branch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .... I hate to ask, but... Did you ever think you'd miss Communism?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We serve the interests of the British people, 007. No matter who we may be foolish enough to elect. Bond is silent, chastised. M looks away, then looks back:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if Elliot Harmsway is involved with that uranium, I want him prosecuted to the ends of the earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopefully, it won't get that far. M looks up: MALCOLM SAUNDERS, Q's successor, limps in, lo mummy - plaster casts on his left leg, left arm; neck-bra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in, Saunders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Saunders. What is it this time? Rocket in the leg? Machine pistol in the arm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Q's retirement party. I'd just put the knife into the cake, and -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. I know better than that - Bond thwacks the crutch against the leg. Saunders GRIMACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... If you insist. Saunders flexes his broken arm; ARMORED SPIKES pop out of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The die is cast. Saunders exchanges a beleaguered glance with M. He takes and neck-brace, and places a BRIEFCASE on M's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now pay attention, 007. We haven't much time to demonstrate your new Q toys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is old Q?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gone fishing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fishing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big game fishing. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonar torpedoes. Retirement gift from his friends at the CIA. Saunders has opened the briefcase. Bond tries to look ins Saunders repositions it. Saunders continues:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the meantime, perhaps this will spark your interest. (takes out a disposable lighter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cigarette lighter. Thumb here, press here - A small flame appears. Bond, unimpressed, reaches for it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saunders, I've lit cigarettes -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not from forty feet. Saunders flips the lighter sideways and - WHOOSH! A burst shoots across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The disposable lighter also contains a small self-detonation charge (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depending on who - or what - you wish to dispose of. Bond takes the lighter, begins to play with it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop fidgeting, 007. Next - He takes out a pair of SHOELACES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Shoelaces?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plastique explosive shoelaces. (holding them out at length)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut them to regulate the size of the blast; totally harmless until you attach the detonator hidden in the heel of your shoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (examining them curiously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect way to tie up a... 'Knotty' problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frowns)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving along - (he produces:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A typical plastic security card. Name here, magnetic information stripe here - (pointing to)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a code breaking microprocessor here. Swipe it through any card reader - anywhere - you're in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it work on cash machines? Saunders is suddenly stricken. Flustered. He blurts out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was an authorized test. I returned the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring this)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, your new watch: Blue laser here for signaling or burning through locks; press this button, the sweep hand becomes a Geiger counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (needling him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you can't do the time, don't do the crime?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smirks at Bond, pauses, then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I almost forgot. There is one last thing: Before Q retired, he asked that I give you one other protective device. He hands Bond a WEDDING BAND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wedding band??? What am I supposed to be able to do with this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe Q's exact words were: (imitating Q, emphatically:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Hopefully, nothing." Bond turns from Saunder's devious grin to an amused M. Sm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'll give you a ring from Venice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck on your mission, 007. He snaps the ring down on her desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Till death do us part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GLEAMING WHITE YACHT - with two on-board helicopters, a tarped hold - dominates the harbor. (Harmsway's SEA DOLPH Tonight, however, we find a GONDOLA, gliding through the Arriving at a festively-lit dock, crowded with gaily cost partygoers and musicians in medieval garb. Wearing the mask from M's office, (and a bright blue cape alights the gondola, and plunges into the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A swirl of colors, noise and music. Pushing his way into celebration, Bond scans the crowd, looking for a face: NOTHING BUT A SEA OF MASKS. White. Yellow. Red. Blue. Caught up in the tumult, he turns left, he strains to tur anxiously looking for the contact. Who is it? THREE MASKED WOMEN appear in front of Bond. They curtsy,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buona sera, signore - He's spun by a MASKED MAN with a bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vino? Bond waves him off - and is jostled in the other directio group of celebrants carrying a long banner. Suddenly, the CROWD SURGES FORWARD: A PROCESSION, carryin EFFIGY OF CARNIVAL is making its way through the square. Locked shoulder to shoulder in the crowd, Bond struggles forward - left, right - when he FEELS A TUG at his cape f He can only crane his neck to see/hear -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I may have been followed. Meet me at the Church in five minutes! With an effort, Bond turns to look at her - but sees noth the wisp of a satin costume, disappearing as the crowd cl behind him.

dialogues.speaker: SAN GIACOMO SQUARE
dialogues.text: Five minutes later. Almost deserted. A few stray couples. MASKED WOMAN appears, walking tentatively between the sha the moonlight, looking for Bond. Suddenly - Whomp! - an arm reaches out, and yanks her into an alcove

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking for someone? Recovering her breath (it was a violent yank,) the woman removes her mask. She shines a sexy, 1000-watt smile at 0

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, James. Bond reacts. He is not happy to see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paris?!? What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that any way to say hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought your specialty was good-bye. Paris smiles coyly. She LIFTS A HAND to tousle his hair -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, James. I've missed you -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing her by the wrist)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this another one of your games?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it! You're hurting me! Can't you just be nice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got half the British government breathing down my neck. I don't have time for your nonsense. She's surprised - and hurt - by his coldness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you even miss me? Didn't I mean anything to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. She turns away from him, fighting back tears. Bond doesn'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Elliot Harmsway? Or is this just another one of your stunts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anguished)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! He's crazy - he's insane. He hates everybody. He's got these plans - (facing Bond, becoming hysterical:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to help me, James. I'm sorry. I'm sorry for everything. I know I was wrong - but you've got to protect me. I know you still love - BOND SLAPS HER. She's stunned. He waits. She's angered:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you feel better now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not giving an inch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you? She turns away. Bond feels remorse for hitting her. Softe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the uranium?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on the boat. He's holding a press conference tomorrow. Bond reaches out to touch her. She falls into his arms, b face in his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry, James. I promise, I'll never leave you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (patting her head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hold me. Bond thinks for a moment, then gently pushes her away, a backwards, to look in her eyes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know Harmsway? Paris' eyes flicker at something over Bond's shoulder. Sh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiss me. She pulls Bond to her, kissing him - then HAULS OFF, BELT across the mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bastard! Leave me alone! She shoves him off, darts away. Bond is bleeding from his and not altogether surprised at her behavior. He turns to

dialogues.speaker: SAN GIACOMO SQUARE
dialogues.text: Paris running to FOUR MEN dressed alike in three-corner h enveloped from head-to-foot in BLACK CAPES. Their faces a completely concealed behind flat, bone-white masks coveri their chins. They look like messengers of death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The leader is STAMPER; the others are locals, THUG #1, #2 #1 is built like a bank vault.) Stamper looks steadily at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody. Just some drunk. Leave him alone -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Thug #3)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take her to the boat.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN ON BOND -
dialogues.text: He sees STAMPER and the TWO HENCHMEN approaching. He turn quickly toward -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pushing past carnival-goers, Bond rushes up the central s the bridge. At the top, looking onto the main span, he se THE EFFIGY OF CARNIVAL PROCESSION, approaching like a tid BOND throws a look over his shoulder, and SEES THE THREE up the stairs, knocking people out of the way like bowlin completely unaware of the oncoming parade at the top. BOND turns to face the men... And suddenly THROWS HIS CAP dramatically, like Batman - blocking their view of the pr STAMPER AND THE TWO THUGS hesitate for a moment - And BOND PULLS THE CAPE TO HIS BODY, just as the PROCESSI PAST HIM, and spills down the stairs, overwhelming Stampe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself, flexing the cape)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's how he does it. Bond disappears into the oncoming crowd. Stamper and Thug #2 are pushed to the bottom of the stair Thug #1 bulls his way up, shouldering through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: RIALTO BRIDGE
dialogues.text: As Bond nears the bottom of the staircase, he looks back THUG #1 is coming down the stairs like an infernal machin carnival-goers aside like rag-dolls. Spotting Bond, he ch But gets caught between TWO MEN CARRYING A SATIN BANNER. right through it - ripping the material apart with his ba pulling the men down, after him.

dialogues.speaker: BASE OF THE RIALTO BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Bond turns past the wall at the bottom of the colonnade. A GROUP OF TOURISTS, posing for a photo by the bridge - and just beyond this - A STREET SELLER hawking souvenirs from a PUSH CART. BOND approaches the TOURIST with the camera, offering to picture for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prego, prego. Permissio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grazie. Bond takes the camera. The tourists pose. And with perfec Bond turns, and - POP! - sets off the FLASHBULB in THUG # just as he comes around the corner. Bond flips the camera back to the tourist -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grazie - And heads for the PUSHCART. Wheeling it around, he SHOVES thug, who is still stumbling, blinded by the flashbulb. The CART SLAMS INTO THE MAN, knocking him on his back. Th stops on top of him, pinning him down. BOND takes off, threading through the crowd toward a SIDE Meanwhile, THE STREET SELLER rushes to his wrecked cart. in the air as Thug #1 jumps to his feet. He's getting rea off. He looks around for Bond - just catching a glimpse o 007 disappears down the sidestreet. Thug #1 makes a bee-line for Bond - but finds his path bl MOTORCYCLISTS, chatting away. Barely stopping, Thug #1 li the motorcycles - with the driver still in the seat - and INTO THE CANAL.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN ON THE BASE OF THE BRIDGE -
dialogues.text: Stamper and Thug #2 arrive at the wrecked cart - in time #1 disappear onto the side Street. Stamper motions for Thug #2 to come with him on a paralle along the canals toward -

dialogues.speaker: THE PLAZA SAN SALVATORE
dialogues.text: Bond enters the deserted plaza from the side-street. Stic to the buildings, he ducks into an alleyway.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEYWAY
dialogues.text: Shrinking back into the shadows, Bond peers out into the

dialogues.speaker: THE PLAZA
dialogues.text: Stamper and Thug 2 charge in. Bond watches as they split start looking for him.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN ON BOND
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a huge hand grabs 007's shoulder, spinning him THUG #1 has Bond in his grasp, with murder his eyes. In o move, Bond side-steps, ducks, and twists out of the cloak it over the Thug's head. And as the Thug struggles to get under it, Bond slams him head-first into a wall, knocking (He's left sitting upright, slumped against the wall.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond heads off down the alleyway, away from the Plaza, to courtyard of Il Bovolo.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN ON ALLEYWAY ENTRANCE -
dialogues.text: Thug #2 enters, spots the figure in Bond's cloak. Very qu pulls out his gun, kneels... And as he brings the gun up cloaked figure's head, chambering a round - The cloak erupts, with Thug #1 viciously biting Thug #2's hurling him against the opposite wall. With a frustrated fury, Thug #1 rips off the cloak, and s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marco - I didn't know -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After him! They charge off.

dialogues.speaker: IL BOVOLO
dialogues.text: Bond enters from the alley, scans the courtyard: Three wa way out... Save for a SPIRAL STAIRCASE that leads up to t FLOOR INTERIOR BALCONY, overlooking the courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: THE SPIRAL STAIRS -
dialogues.text: Bond takes the marble steps, two at a time.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN ON THE COURTYARD -
dialogues.text: The two Thugs enter the square. Motioning for quiet, they BOND'S FOOTFALLS on the steps, and race up after him.

dialogues.speaker: THE BALCONY -
dialogues.text: Coming off the staircase, Bond tries the doors to the int building: Locked. Too heavy to burst in. He glances down courtyard, and HEARS THE THUGS' FOOTSTEPS running up the Bond glances up to the roof, just above his head: The onl Pocketing his mask, Bond hops on the BANISTER, REACHES fo GUTTER. He pulls himself up, throws a leg over - onto the disappears from sight... Just as the Thugs enter the balcony from the staircase.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST ROOFTOP -
dialogues.text: Bond scurries along the steeply pitched terra-cotta roof. SHEER DROPS on three sides - but the fourth side is a one to an adjoining building. Bond jumps.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND, (LOWER)
dialogues.text: 007 lands on another steeply pitched roof; unable to get on the tiles, he slides down, rolling to the edge. He loo The adjoining building is one story lower, with a skyligh As Bond struggles to climb back to the peak of the second

dialogues.speaker: RETURN ON THE BALCONY -
dialogues.text: Thug #1 holsters his gun, and climbs on the banister. He' to climb onto the roof by himself - so Thug #2 shoves him

dialogues.speaker: FIRST ROOFTOP -
dialogues.text: Thug #1 searches for Bond. He HEARS BOND moving, below hi next building. He makes a running leap.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND, (LOWER)
dialogues.text: Bond has hauled himself up to a crouch as Thug #1 lands. grapple. The Thug sends Bond sliding down toward the edge roof, then loses his balance, and slides down after Bond. AT THE EDGE OF THE ROOF, Bond is about to slide off, onto skylight below, but GRABS THE COPPER GUTTER at the last m 007 is now hanging, fifteen feet above a glass skylight.. tumbles off the edge of the roof, and saves himself by GR BOND'S LEGS. They sway in the air for a second. The GUTTER bends, brea two of them fall -

dialogues.speaker: VENICE MEDIEVAL ARMOR MUSEUM
dialogues.text: They land in a shower of glass on the grand banquet table Great Hall. Bond is winded. Thug #1, unfazed. He grabs Bo collar, hauling him up on his feet. Thug #1 shoves the nose of his gun under Bond's chin, for on his toes. Snarling, he thrusts his face menacingly clo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I owe you some pain. With lightning speed, Bond: 1) Grasps the Thug's elbow an gun arm forward, as, 2) Bond pitches his head back. Bond' clears the barrel as THE GUN FIRES INTO THE CEILING. The flash momentarily blinds Thug #1. Bond snatches a CAN and smashes it against the Thug's arm, knocking the gun a As BOND DRAWS HIS WALTHER, the Thug grabs Bond's wrist, a (yet effortlessly) SQUEEZES THE GUN from 007's hand, ONTO With a sick smile, the Thug tosses Bond into a corner of He's having fun.

dialogues.speaker: AS BOND STAGGERS, PICKING HIMSELF UP FROM THE CORNER -
dialogues.text: THUG #1 tosses aside a massive table and chairs to get at BOND shoves a SUIT OF ARMOR (on wheels) at Thug #1 - who of the way, like a gnat. Concerned this might be getting serious, BOND grabs an OA the shattered table. He wields it like a bat, to ward off Unimpressed, the THUG SMASHES HIS FIST INTO a GLASS DISPL and plucks out a CLAYMORE - a two-handed "King Arthur" ty With one roundhouse blow, THUG #1 SLICES BOND'S TABLE LEG The Thug swings the Claymore a second time, forcing Bond

dialogues.speaker: A DISPLAY WALL -
dialogues.text: filled with pole weapons. Bond snatches a lethal-looking (Ax, fluke and spike on a staff.) Thug #1 stops in his tr Drops the Claymore. Grabs a pole-ax. THE TWO MEN face off in a short, furious battle, which en #1 shattering Bond's Halberd with the pole-ax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gripping the pole-ax horizontally in both hands, Thug #1 backward, to a SECOND DISPLAY WALL that features AN IRON (Something like a hinged sarcophagus, lined with spikes.) Thug #1 tries to push 007 into the case, but Bond side-st last minute. Thug #1 lurches forward, and is only stopped killing himself by the pole-ax hitting the sides of the i As Thug #1 steps back, Bond grabs a MORNING-STAR from the studded iron ball on a chain attached to a club) Bond swings the Morning-Star down, SNAPPING THUG #1'S POL TWO... But loses the weapon in the process. Now, Thug #1 lunges for Bond's throat. Grappling, they sl wall next to the IRON MAIDEN - which is STARTING TO COME THE LEATHER STRAPS holding it upright.  - In a near death-grip, Bond manages to push/kick/smash Thu backwards, down onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: THUG
dialogues.text: And at the very last second, BOND DISLODGES THE HAND-AX, IRON MAIDEN'S LEATHER RETAINING STRAPS and -

dialogues.speaker: FROM INSIDE THE IRON MAIDEN'S POV -
dialogues.text: The iron maiden falls forward, impaling Thug #1 on the wo

dialogues.speaker: RETURN TO SCENE -
dialogues.text: The Iron Maiden covers all of Thug #1, except for his arm clutching Bond's gun. Bond bends down and retrieves it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fought hard... (holstering the gun)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the case was terminal. And on this note, we -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under a beautiful blue sky, the gleaming white SEA DOLPHI dock, festooned with pennants and banners. There's a crow At the same time, however, 500 feet away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond meets with Signore DiGIACOMO, a middle-aged Italian official in shirtsleeves. Two underlings hover in the bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've confirmed all the legal details with M? DiGIACOMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Si. Bueno. She's very... 'Competent.' ...For a woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go over this one more time. DiGIACOMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will investigate the boat. You'll signal us if you find the enriched uranium. And then - (distracted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon. He looks at a WOMAN who has appeared with a baby in her a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Franco. I just want to say we're voting for you in the election. DiGIACOMO (teasing, re: the baby)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both of you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. DiGIACOMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grazie, grazie. Ciao. She leaves. He turns back Bond: DiGIACOMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. You'll signal us if you find the uranium -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you'll wait until after the press conference - and everyone is gone - before you board the boat and arrest him. DiGIACOMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfecto. Then we turn him over to you, and the English government puts him on a military transport back to London. Bond nods, looks over at the Sea Dolphin II. DiGIACOMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not worry, my friend. I only want what is best. For both of us. Bond stands to leave. DiGiacomo smiles after 007 - as if savoring some private secret. He snaps his fingers to an DiGIACOMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocco! Un Cappuccino!

dialogues.speaker: THE SEA DOLPHIN II -
dialogues.text: As Bond makes his way up the gangplank - ELLIOT HARMSWAY is holding a press conference near the bo ed by dignitaries. He is a man with an EVIL EUPHORIA - sh all the charm and charisma that's made him one of the wor powerful media tycoons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And so, it's somewhat fitting that we are here today... To christen this environmental research boat in Venice - - 'Venezia' - the port where Marco Polo sailed forth to explore the world's great uncharted oceans... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That 2/3 of the earth's surface where the sharks are not working members of the press. Laughter. Bond studies the man. Harmsway continues, point LARGE DRILL/BORING OBJECT, the size of a jet engine, atta long flexible hose/tube.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With our six custom designed sea-bed coring drills, we will probe the long-term effects of pollution; our sonars, radars, and research labs will study the wind, the water, and the sea life that so dearly feeds us. Bond moves through the crowd. He spots a bulkhead, with a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so, in the spirit of international cooperation - thanking my good friend, Valentin Zukofsky - the newly elected President of the Ukraine for all his assistance - He motions to Zukofsky, who nods to the audience...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I give this boat to mankind - selflessly - in pure charity asking nothing for myself... But the cable TV rights. Big laugh from the assemblage. Harmsway turns to a BEAUTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Venice? If you'll do the honors - SMASH! She cracks a champagne bottle on the tip of the bo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I'll take some questions from the press - even the few of you who aren't on my payroll. Laughter. Harmsway points to a reporter:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Harmsway: Why did you name this boat the Sea Dolphin II?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, my first choice was 'No Comment.' So if someone asked where I was, I could truthfully respond 'No Comment.' (laughter; he points)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir Elliot: Is it true you're in negotiations to move your offices from Hong Kong to Kuala Lumpur?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impishly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No comment. Amidst more laughter, Bond disappears into the bulkhead d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond moves cautiously down a STAIRCASE... And peers along a CORRIDOR. He sees a GUARD, checking doo sure they're locked. Bond withdraws for a moment, looks b guard is at the far end of the hall. He lifts a WALKIE-TA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Level one, secure. The guard exits, down another staircase. Bond moves steal the corridor, glancing at signs on various doors: FISH HA WEATHER STATION, CREW'S MESS, etc... Until he comes to: METALLURGY LAB. There's a CARD READER by the door. Bond s his Q-toy, swipes it. Click. He goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond clocks the lab: Power tools, test benches, a SECOND DOOR... And in the middle of the room - THE RED BOX. Quickly, (as the echoes of Harmsway's press conference ca through the portholes,) Bond examines the edges of the bo for tamper-proof seals. Finds none. Gingerly, he opens it URANIUM SLUGS. They look like black tennis ball canisters BOND presses a button on his watch: THE GEIGER COUNTER CL Bond pauses. Wants to make sure. He spots ANOTHER GEIGER a bench; he moves its probe over the uranium slugs: Same Bond closes the box. He decides to check out the rest of examining gadgets, tools, chemicals. HE OPENS A SHALLOW D And finds a set of BLACK ROTARY CUTTING SAWS, WITH ELONGA (They look almost like a series of sharks' jaws - one ova another ) Bond lifts one - surprised at its extreme weight. He wond is used for. Just then - THERE'S A CLICK AT THE SECOND DOOR. Bond quickly replaces cutting saw, moves to the first door - And as the SECOND DOOR OPENS, Bond slips out the first, i CORRIDOR, down the hall, heading for the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE METALLURGY LAB -
dialogues.text: YUNG enters, his hairless head shining under the lights. around, sensing something is wrong. Glances: Not the red the Geiger counter. But then he notices it: THE DRAWER is sticking out, maybe a sixteenth of an inch. Yung picks up a telephone.

dialogues.speaker: SEA DOLPHIN II
dialogues.text: Bond emerges from the bulkhead door. The press conference up. As Bond makes his way to the RAIL, looking out on the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The maiden voyage begins tonight. I have some business in London - but the ship will sail down the Nile, across the South China Sea, stopping in Australia, winding up in San Francisco. Bond stands at the rail, AIMS HIS WATCH at the cafe - HARMSWAY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But having said that - let's get to the real business - the only thing that attracts newsmen faster than a breaking story the free food and beverage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DiGiacomo sees the BLUE LASER. Motions his men to action.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN ON THE SEA DOLPHIN II
dialogues.text: Bond has sauntered to one of the hospitality bars, trying ac inconspicuous as possible. A hand clasps his shoulder:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. James Bond! Bond spins to see Valentin, surrounded by the usual assor cheaply dressed goons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentin. What an unpleasant surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it that brings you to Venezia, Mr. Bond? Business - (sly glance to the thugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or somebody else's business? The goons chortle. Bond isn't happy with this attention. a VIDEO SURVEILLANCE CAMERA ON ONE OF THE MASTS, scanning A WOMAN'S SHRILL WHINING VOICE - brings Bond back to Vale is very colorfully dressed - dripping in high-ticket logo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dimitri!!! You promised I could go shopping!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto, to Bond)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New mistress. (to her, impatiently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need money. Valentin gives a beleaguered shrug, and pulls out a HUGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Take an inch. Shaking his head, Valentin turns back to Bond:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come. Let me buy you a drink. It's free. With Bond keeping an eye on the surveillance camera, they several steps to the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the bartender)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two vodka martini's. Shaken. Not stirred. (to Bond)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you? Bond would rather not drink - but knows that any change f regular behavior might arouse suspicion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One. As the bartender pours:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must say, Valentin, capitalism seems to be treating you well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (belting one back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to sell weapons; now I buy votes. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off the record.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. If you can't beat the government, you might as well own it. Valentin spots someone off-camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait - I want you to meet a friend of mine. (calling out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliot! Elliot! Come here. Harmsway appears. Ebullient as ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliot Harmsway, I want to introduce you to an old friend -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putting out a hand to shake)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The name is Bond. James Bond. Harmsway greets Bond with a warm smile. Yet his words are

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always nice to meet one of her Majesty's fellow subjects... (a nod to Valentin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Especially one with such distinguished friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might say I've always been one of Mr. Valentin's biggest followers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chortling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Biggest followers?' He's practically made a career' of it!! He laughs. Bond decides to pull Harmsway's chain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a beautiful boat, Sir Elliot. Practically glows in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can tell you're a man with an eye for exquisite possessions, Mr. Bond. (signaling off camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darling! Come here. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to meet my wife. A woman appears in frame, her face obscured by a large su she reveals her face to the camera - and Bond -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paris Harmsway, allow me to introduce you to James Bond. There is a terrified look on her face. Harmsway continues his most insinuating smile:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then... I believe you two have already met. There is a beat - an uncomfortable moment when nobody spe

dialogues.speaker: POLICE WHISTLES BLOW
dialogues.text: The entire party turns to see DiGIACOMO barging his way u gangplank - wearing a ludicrous military uniform, trailed TOTING CARBINIERI, along with his own VIDEO AND STILL CRE DiGIACOMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliot Harmsway: Under the auspices of the Italian government, I, Franco DiGiacomo - (pauses; smiles at a camera; POP! A flash goes off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am arresting you for the illegal possession of weapons grade enriched uranium. (to his underlings)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seize the boat! A set of frozen glances goes from Bond, to Paris, to Harm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I suddenly remembered an urgent meeting in Moscow. To everyone's surprise, Harmsway guffaws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friends, there's been a terrible mistake. (putting his arm around DiGiacomo)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come. Let me show you. And he leads the procession off, through the bulkhead doo left with Paris. She is white with fear. Bond moves to co

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paris -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone! He's going to kill me!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me? Why wasn't it in our files?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anguished)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't want anyone to know. He kept it out of the papers. He said a third wife was bad for his image. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to protect me! Bond wants to help her - and follow Harmsway. He pulls ou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to my hotel room. I'll be there in twenty minutes. Paris looks up at him like a hurt child. She wants some c wants to hear him say 'I love you.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just - say it. Say it just once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pauses, discomfited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One thing at a time. I'll see you in twenty minutes. Go. She exits; he goes to the bulkhead door... And we pan up SURVEILLANCE CAMERA, following him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harmsway holds court near the red box. Bond squeezes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe this is what you're looking for, Colonel. He opens the red box. Hoists out a canister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it uranium? Absolutely. But watch - (runs the Geiger counter over it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's depleted uranium! Completely safe! A child could sleep on it. Bond can't believe what he's seeing. DiGiacomo is mortifi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I received it from the Russian government - a by-product of their nuclear arms program - in the hopes that I could create tools for oceanographic research. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's what I was talking about: 'Swords into plowshares'! The Sprit of International Cooperation! DiGIACOMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Signore Harmsway. A thousand apologies. (snaps his fingers to a lackey:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give him the video tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. No harm done, Don Franco. Go upstairs, and enjoy the reception. As the room empties, he calls -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh - Mr. Bond. One minute. Bond approaches him. They're the only people in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you've enjoyed this little charade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which part? The Colonel's? Or yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (icily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A piece of advice, Mr. Bond: Don't screw with a man who buys ink by the ton. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's deadlier than uranium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring him down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see about that. Harmsway glances at his watch. Smiles coldly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you late for a meeting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond rushes down the gangplank, along the dock. Jumps in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Danielli. Presto!

dialogues.speaker: RETURN ON THE METALLURGY LAB -
dialogues.text: Harmsway closes the door. Yung is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was too close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. Mr. Bond will get the message. So will his boss. Harmsway presses a button - and suddenly the red box lift second red box appears underneath it, like shuffling a de

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to the plane. Tell the captain to set sail at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond jumps out of the gondola, sprints into the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: FOURTH FLOOR CORRIDOR -
dialogues.text: Bond appears, rushing up a staircase. He comes to his doo closed, but unlocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond enters the room. Looks around, calling out -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paris? Paris? He sees the French doors open onto the canal. The curtain outward. Bond rushes to the window and looks down:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paris Harmsway is dead, floating in the water.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN ON BOND -
dialogues.text: Crushed. Devastated. And to make matters worse: DiGIACOMO'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Signore Bond? Bond turns. A flashbulb goes off, capturing Bond and DiGi DiGIACOMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're under arrest.

dialogues.speaker: THE SOUTH CHINA SEA
dialogues.text: The HMS INDOMITABLE - a 3,300 ton British frigate, surges water, heading toward the setting sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BATTLE-DRESSED ROYAL MARINES patrol the deck; GUNNERY CRE weapons. Whatever is going on here, it's not business as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on A VERTICAL GLASS MAP. An electronic panel displa BLINKING YELLOW DOT indicates -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've cleared Hong Kong harbor, sir. THE CAPTAIN nods. Turns to the GPS OFFICER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Position? The GPS officer enters keyboard commands on console marke POSITIONING SATELLITE." He reads out the data:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-two, zed-three, one-five north; a hundred fourteen degrees, five minutes, ten seconds east.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Locked on satellite, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set course, two-ten degrees, south south east.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming about, sir. The Captain is all business - clipped, sober terse. Turns FIRST OFFICER, hands him a SLIP OF PAPER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orders from London: For the next ninety-six hours, we're to run on full radio silence. Double watches, full alert. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're to send one encrypted positioning burst to London every six hours - otherwise, zero electronic emissions. The first officer nods. CAPTAIN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inform the men, then run a surprise inspection. If someone paints us, I don't want this ship showing up on their radar screen like some god-damned Harrod's Christmas tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be in my cabin until oh-six- hundred hours. The Captain heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain leaving the bridge. The officers salute as he exits. With a shrug, the FIRST picks up the INTERCOM MICROPHONE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attention all hands. Now hear this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crowded with CREW MEMBERS eating, waiting on line for foo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will rig immediately for electronic silence. All electronic gear is to be shut down...

dialogues.speaker: COOK
dialogues.text: At microwave. His finger hovers over button, then stops. the door of the microwave and takes out a bowl. Dumps the on the stove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CREW MEMBER with an ELECTRIC SHAVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All personal radios, video devices and computers will be stowed at once. He stops shaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ENGINEER shouts to his crew, over NOISE OF DIESEL ENG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check the engine baffles; rig the generators for shielded operation.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN ON THE BRIDGE -
dialogues.text: The First Officer stands next to the Communications Offic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Communications set to receive only, sir. The First Officer looks over the shoulder of RATING at ra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Radar switched to passive mode; sonar re-set to low-power operation. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You couldn't find our signature with a magnifying glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's hope so. The First Officer joins the Second Officer at the windows the horizon with binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like we're in for a long, uncomfortable trip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll all breathe a lot easier when we get this cargo back to London.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BAGPIPE AND DRUM CORPS of the Royal Highland Regiment "Black Watch") is playing a FUNERAL DIRGE outside a vast with a HARMSWAY NEWS HELICOPTER on the lawn, and LIMOUSIN and a FLOWER CAR in the driveway. SIX MEN IN FORMAL MOURNING ATTIRE are entering the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SINGLE WHITE ROSE is added to a pile of white roses in HARMSWAY'S OPEN CASKET. REVEAL: We're in mid-procession: The last two (of the six outside) place roses in the casket... Then turn, nodding sorrowfully to ELLIOT HARMSWAY (sittin front row of a room that's keen turned into a makeshift c And follow hand signals of STAMPER, who motions them THRO to an unseen room. After the last man has paid his respects, HARMSWAY stands the bier, and - wiping away a tear - places a single RED dead wife's casket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in a room that looks as if it could only exist in, James Bond movie: Slick, stark, sterile. Steel, glass, ch The SIX men are seated around a giant conference table, l absurdly out of place in their formal mourning attire. Elliot Harmsway enters, (passing what appears to be the L that hangs in the lobby of CAA,) walks to the head of the takes off his gray mourning gloves, slaps them down, and:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Gentlemen. I'm sorry to bring you here under these circumstances, but (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Considering our meeting was already scheduled, this was a happy coincidence. The men nod. Harmsway sits, dims the lights from a contro HARMSWAY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Number One, your report? A gap-toothed Californian with bland features stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir Elliot: The entertainment division is releasing three new animated children's movies this year. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the time we're finished promoting them on our TV, radio, cable, newspaper, and magazine outlets - (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There won't be a parent in the universe who won't feel guilty if they don't take their children to our stores and theme parks to buy the toys, books, video- games and clothing featuring our 'lovable little creatures.' (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We anticipate revenues of 3.1 billion dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent, Number One. Build a better rat-trap, and the world truly will beat a path to your theme park. (turns to)
