dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Number Two? A young guy with glasses gets up, looking remarkably like

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you're aware, Sir Elliot, our software division has introduced a new computer operating system, Gates '99. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's deliberately filled with bugs - so people will be forced to buy our upgrades over the next five years. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The window on revenues is 2.8 billion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outstanding, Number Two. (beat, remembering:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way - Number Five - ? (a man looks up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's ahead in the American elections?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Democrat, sir. By nine points.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's time to publish that story about his sex life. Even things up. A close race is always better for our TV ratings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Consider him slimed, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Splendid. Next... (with noticeable reserve)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Number Three. Your report? A SHORT MIDDLE-EASTERN MAN stands. Nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I regret to inform you, sir, that Saddam Hussein is still demanding a bonus for his role in the Gulf War.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Haven't we already paid him for his services?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. But he still feels his people should share in the increased profits of our news division. He has proposed an additional 500 million dollar payment. A pause. The other men in the room shift uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And there's no truth that 10% of that money will go into your Swiss bank account?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sir! I swear! This is not true!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You disappoint me, Number Three. Harmsway presses a button. Stamper enters. Number Three a this means death. He BEGS FOR HIS LIFE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please sir. Please -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...But because I am a just man, I've decided to give Mr. Hussein what he deserves. Number Three is confused. Does this mean he's going to li

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Stamper will escort you to the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overwhelmed with gratitude)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you sir! Thank you! Harmsway nods, watching him leave:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-bye, Mr. Azziz. And the man is gone. Harmsway turns his attention back to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's proceed with new business. Harmsway presses another button. The room darkens. The CE THE TABLE OPENS, and a 3-D MAP OF MALAYSIA rises into vie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen: In exactly 36 hours, we are going to initiate phase one of the word's most perfect crime: The biggest theft in the history of mankind. (beat, pointing with a laser)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here. In the Strait of Malacca.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stamper holds the back door open for Number Three. He get

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He seems relieved, until the doors lock, ominously. They

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Number Three fidgets in the back... And notices Stamper s him in the REARVIEW MIRROR. He sees Stamper reach INTO HI and PANICS! Is he going to get shot? Is it over? He wince

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gum? Shaking his head, he pulls out a HANDKERCHIEF to mop the

dialogues.speaker: RETURN ON THE MANOR HOUSE
dialogues.text: Amidst ad-libbed 'good-bye's" from the gang of six (now f Harmsway gets in the waiting HNN chopper. It powers up, t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stamper's limousine parks near a Gulfstream jet. He opens door for Number Three. At last, the man believes he is sa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you! Thank you so much. You must thank Sir Elliot for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (producing a NEWSPAPER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Something to read on the plane. Stamper TUCKS THE PAPER FIRMLY UNDER #3'S ARM - and gives friendly pat on the back, sending him up the stairs. At the doorway, Number Three looks back. Stamper smiles,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye-bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Number Three settles into his seat. The door closes; the wind up for take-off. He sighs: He's safe. He casually pi newspaper, snaps open the front page:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screaming headline: ISRAELI AGENT REVEALED. There's a FUL PHOTO OF NUMBER THREE underneath. Number Three lowers the paper, white as a ghost, and - TWO ARABIAN GENTLEMEN (in full burnoose) sit down on eith him. They smile. And on NUMBER THREE'S BLOOD-CURDLING SCR

dialogues.speaker: THE H.M.S. INDOMITABLE -
dialogues.text: Moving through FOG in the STRAIT OF MALACCA, night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is bathed in blue light as the crew monitors the ble's command and control systems. At the VERTICAL GLASS MAP, the ship's course has been cha Hong Kong, south, down around Singapore, then north, wher BLINKING dot indicates it's currently in the Strait of Ma Standing in front of the map, however, THE NAVIGATION OFF perplexed. He's comparing what's on the screen to a piece in his hand. Something is wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... This doesn't make sense. What's our heading now? THE HELMSMAN looks down at his compass/auto-pilot. INSERT COMPASS/AUTO-PILOT - moving from West to North - t on a North position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zero one three. Due north. The two officers share a look. Something is odd, but -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on course again. Just then, the FIRST OFFICER ENTERS from the exterior bri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't see a damn thing in this fog. (calling out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rating: What have we got? He joins the RATING and COMMUNICATION'S OFFICERS at their

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A passenger ferry and two freighters broadcasting on low-band -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And two small fishing boats about 30k north. No radar, but we've identified their engine signatures. As the First Officer takes this in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. It's doing it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (joining him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About every ninety seconds, the auto- pilot jogs us to the west. He points down to the compass/auto-pilot, SWINGING WEST..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then re-sets us to the north. The compass reaches dead west - then starts to swing back HELMSMAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain wants us on the East side of the channel. ...Cross current?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in the Strait. (to the Navigator)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's our position?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to the satellite, we're exactly on course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you check the auto-pilot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back-up does the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check it again. What about the global positioning satellite? Could there be something wrong with the signal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two words: Im-possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the earth turns below, a TINY SILVER DOT appears in th A COMMUNICATIONS SATELLITE, spinning slowly on its axis. It comes closer and closer to camera, until it FILLS THE the LOGO on its body ROTATES INTO VIEW: HNN. THE HARMSWAY NEWS NETWORK.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN ON BRIDGE
dialogues.text: THE HELMSMAN finishes fiddling with the auto-pilot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is it now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems to be back to normal, sir. The First Officer nods... Then HEARS a SHRILL WARNING BEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have something off the port bow! The First Officer rushes to join him at the screen. SONAR OPERATOR (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 100 meters out, just below the surface. (adjusts the controls)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A meter in diameter; ten - twelve meters long. ...Floating vertically?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dead head. (off the others' quizzical looks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water logged timber. Floats straight up. You sometimes see them on the east side of the channel - from the logging camps on Sumatra - but they don't usually float this far west. (calling out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muncy! Engines to half!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye-aye sir. Engines to half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (explaining)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chew up a log like that in the propeller, you end up with enough paperwork to go from here to London. Twice.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The ship is moving towards a DARK VERTICAL SHAPE - Harmsw CORE BORING DRILL (shorthand "THE WORM',) attached to a l dredging pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motionless, hanging in the water. Then the monster awakes sphere retracts, revealing a wide angle CAMERA LENS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Communications Officer reacts to his monitor with ALA

dialogues.speaker: COMMUNICATIONS OFFICER
dialogues.text: I'm getting an electrical emission, sir! Extremely close. Bearing 240 - The First Officer is surprised. All hell is about to brea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Punch up the radar -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got it, sir. A large craft - XX,OOO tons. Range - (disbelief)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 200 yards? It's anchored in a cove!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's impossible! We're in the middle of the channel! A Junior officer bursts in from the exterior bridge:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breakers off the port bow! We're heading for shore!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reacting to the Jr. Officer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full stop!!! Call the captain!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The log is moving!

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Propelled by water-jets in its head, THE WORM STREAKS TOW INDOMITABLE, emitting a HIGH PITCHED whine as its drill b to speed. The drill's BLACK TEETH glisten in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closing in on the hull like a torpedo. It gets closer, pi speed, until - on IMPACT -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TORRENT OF WATER engulfs the Engineer and Crewmen when bursts/drills through the hull. As they scream, drowning A CREWMAN ON THE GANTRY scrambles up, one step ahead of t through a bulkhead, into -

dialogues.speaker: GENERATOR ROOM
dialogues.text: Where the CREWMAN and TWO OPERATORS struggle to CLOSE THE AGAINST THE WATER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the intercom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been hit! We're taking water!

dialogues.speaker: THE BRIDGE -
dialogues.text: Alarms sound! Red lights flash!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flooding in the engine room!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me damage reports! Start the pumps!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding out a ship's phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the Captain -

dialogues.speaker: PASSAGEWAY
dialogues.text: On a phone, outside the ship's GYM, deep in the hull:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intercut if necessary)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we've been holed, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On my way! He speeds along the passageway, going through a water-tig slamming it behind him. Meanwhile, on -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The engines are gone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flooding on D deck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound the general alarm! Seal all compartments! As the Second Officer grabs the intercom - SECOND OFFICER (into intercom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attention all hands -

dialogues.speaker: CREW'S MESS -
dialogues.text: The crew members look up from their meals - SECOND OFFICER (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proceed to emergency stations -

dialogues.speaker: GENERATOR ROOM -
dialogues.text: The men have closed the door, but... HEAR A HIGH-PITCHED GRINDING SOUND from the other side. They exchange a quizz they don't know what to make of it, when: BANG! The door explodes inward - and a high-pressured str water blasts in, blowing them back against the walls.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE -
dialogues.text: The lights go out! Everyone is scrambling:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've lost power!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to back up generators! SECOND OFFICER (into intercom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Repeat: Seal all compartments, and -

dialogues.speaker: CREW'S MESS -
dialogues.text: In the dim lighting - SECOND OFFICER (on intercom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proceed to emergency stations at once! The men start to move, but halt at A HUMMING SOUND. They around: Where is it coming from? Suddenly a THREE FOOT SECTION OF THE DECK EXPLODES IN A F WATER. The men are swept off their feet.

dialogues.speaker: PASSAGEWAY/GANTRY
dialogues.text: As the Captain rushes up the steps, he turns around, reac

dialogues.speaker: THE CLOSED WATER-TIGHT DOOR -
dialogues.text: BOOM! Water blasts through, like 1000 fire hydrants turne With terror in his eyes, THE CAPTAIN sprints up the rest stairs, through a water-tight door, into:

dialogues.speaker: PASSAGEWAY
dialogues.text: Where the Captain secures the door behind him, and rushes

dialogues.speaker: THE BRIDGE -
dialogues.text: A desperate battle continues:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flooding on C-Deck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell are those generators?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming up, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get those pumps working!

dialogues.speaker: BATTERY ROOM -
dialogues.text: A CREWMAN hurriedly flips switches. The lights flicker... as they some to life, brightly - THE DOOR BURSTS OPEN, and a wall of water and debris blow destroying everything in its wake.

dialogues.speaker: THE BRIDGE -
dialogues.text: Lights out! A sense of helplessness is beginning to fill

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back-up is gone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flooding up to B-Deck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't hold out much longer, sir! All eyes are on the First Officer. Will he save them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell is the Captain?!?!

dialogues.speaker: THE CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Running, the Captain is about to reach the exit door. Hea relentless grinding behind him, he throws a look over his BAM! The entrance door EXPLODES in a thunderball of water The Captain clambers through the exit door to:

dialogues.speaker: PASSAGEWAY
dialogues.text: A short hall: He shuts the entrance door, runs to the exi looks hack again: BAM! The door blasts open - and the torrent of water cont chase, as if it's got a personal vendetta against him. He

dialogues.speaker: PASSAGEWAY
dialogues.text: Slamming the door behind him, the Captain looks ahead, an STAIRS. AN OPEN DOOR AT THE TOP. He throws a look back: THE ENTRANCE DOOR IS BEGINNING TO HUM AND VIBRATE. Sprinting for his life, the Captain rushes up the stairs, time. The humming behind him grows louder. He glances bac THE DOOR BLASTS OPEN. WATER SHOOTS IN. He rushes up the last four steps, just as -

dialogues.speaker: CA-CHUNK
dialogues.text: With PANIC IN HIS EYES, the Captain turns to face the onc tsunami! We cut to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving like a shark... Toward THE CAPTAIN'S LEGS, DEAD AH WATER. As it closes in for the kill -

dialogues.speaker: THE BRIDGE -
dialogues.text: Shifts, suddenly, to the stern. A confusion of anxious vo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slipping to stern!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All major compartments flooded! With all hands still awaiting orders - THE ROOM LURCHES AS THE BOW RISES! Papers fly! Men slide! First Officer has no choice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abandon ship! Break radio silence! Send our position!

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER SCREEN -
dialogues.text: The Communications Officer types: "Top Secret. Indian Oce Command. H.M.S. Indomitable Sinking."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's our position?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading off his screen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One hundred degrees, thirty-one minutes, and seven seconds East, by two degrees, twenty-nine minutes, ten seconds, North. As he types, the room lurches again, tilting more to the

dialogues.speaker: THE CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: As the passageway shifts, tilting to the stern, the Capta and WHOOSH! - is sucked down into the water - the worm's like meat being fed into a Cuisinart: A churning, spinnin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bow rises completely out of the water as the stern goes u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO CREWMAN manage to get a LIFEBOAT away. TWO OTHERS scr from below and leap into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bow is at a forty-five degree angle... And the H.M.S. Indomitable pauses - for just a moment - before SLIPPING FIRST, throwing up a series of great waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocked by waves from the sinking ship. The Cook, a Marine Crewmen hear a splash along side. Two of the Crew pull th OFFICER aboard. He takes a minute to catch his breath, th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six. That's it? Only six of us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of the crew never made it to their life jackets. The Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs, then:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The First officer stayed on the bridge. One of the CREWMAN SPOTS SOMETHING IN THE DISTANCE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey - look! Over there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SEA DOLPHIN II emerges from a cove, looking like a gh apparition in the fog.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN ON THE LIFEBOAT -
dialogues.text: The men yell and wave and whistle, hoping to be saved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliot Harmsway removes a pair of binoculars from his fac YUNG, standing next to him at the rail:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lovely night for a shipwreck, isn't it? Yung looks at Harmsway like he's crazy. Oblivious, Harmsw his WATCH, then looks through the BINOCULARS again - and WHISTLE the opening notes of My Fair Lady's "WOULDN'T IT ("All I want is a room somewhere, far away from the cold

dialogues.speaker: THE LIFEBOAT -
dialogues.text: As the men cry for help, the Sonar Operator spots somethi below the surface, moving toward the lifeboat at great sp He hears the hum. His eyes follow the churning water... And suddenly - out of nowhere - the Worm hits the lifeboa below, smashing it to bits, hurtling the pieces in the ai

dialogues.speaker: THE SEA DOLPHIN II -
dialogues.text: Harmsway lowers the binoculars' smiling. Stamper appears, Harmsway a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've decoded their last transmission. Harmsway studies it for a moment - smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect. They'll be searching miles from here. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time for phase two. You can get the men in the water. And with this, Harmsway turns, and walks off, jauntily wh "Wouldn't It Be Loverly." Stamper looks at Yung, re: Harmsway's glee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard him. Get the men in the water!

dialogues.speaker: SIDE OF THE SEA DOLPHIN II
dialogues.text: In the water next to the chip, FOUR DIVERS drop the last equipment in a DIVE BOAT. They cast off, motoring into th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The classic Michelin building on Fulham road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG WOMAN is yammering away at Bond; he's trying to p face on what is obviously a dreadful fix-up first date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe it took us so long to finally get together! What exactly do you do for the government?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might say... 'Public relations.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How fascinating! I bet you meet all the most fabulous people. Before Bond can answer, the MAITRE D' interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me - Mr. Bond? You have a call. Bond excuses himself.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AT PHONE -
dialogues.text: 007 picks up the receiver, without saying hello:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moneypenny! You're early. You weren't supposed to call until - (he stiffens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I understand. Twenty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passing a NEWSPAPER DELIVERY TRUCK with an ad for "TOMORR Paper that Never Lies,") Bond's DB-5 roars past the guard

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADMIRAL ROEBUCK glares as MINISTER JOHNSTONE enters to ad TANNER, A TREASURY OFFICIAL, and various UNIFORMS and SUI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening. I've just spoken with the Prime Minister at the economic summit in Tokyo; he's expecting a full update within the hour. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For those of you still unaware, some forty minutes ago -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, but - (all turn to him:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must formally protest this meeting. Given the nature of what's occurred - and the need for secrecy - I see no reason to involve the air force, the army, or MI-6. (beat, as M and Tanner exchange a look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is an internal affair that should be handled strictly by the officers of her Majesty's Royal Navy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral, are you suggesting - He's distracted by the CLICK OF A DOOR OPENING. All turn entering, wearing a FULL NAVAL UNIFORM. M stifles a smile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I'm late -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, you're just in time. (she turns to)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral Roebuck: You know Commander Bond, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deflated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've looked forward to meeting you. Bond sits. M glances at Johnstone as if to say "proceed."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I was saying: Approximately forty- five minutes ago, we received an abandon ship signal from the H.M.S. Indomitable. (flicks on a map display)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking at these infrared satellite images - provided by Mr. Tanner of MI-6 -the ship is presumed lost here, just south of Kuala Lumpur, where she broadcast her last position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foreground, empty diving boat. Background, Sea Dolphin II "flexible hose" hanging over the rail, down into the wate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stamper works "worm" master control with a video joystick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divers approaching the hull. Harmsway and Yung look over his shoulder at:

dialogues.speaker: VIDEO SCREEN -
dialogues.text: Through the worm's UNDERWATER camera, FOUR DIVERS with TO WELDING TOOLS are about to enter the HOLE in the Indomita (The video screen also contains lots of digital informati divers and the worm's functions.)

dialogues.speaker: UNDERWATER
dialogues.text: The worm follows the Divers into the hull.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ENGINE ROOM -
dialogues.text: It trails the Divers past debris and bodies of crewman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into microphone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the right, towards the stern. The Divers react, and the worm follows them into...

dialogues.speaker: PASSAGEWAY
dialogues.text: The Divers and worm travel to a HATCH COVERED WITH METAL Lighting the welding torches, they try to cut through the bars... Unsuccessfully.

dialogues.speaker: VIDEO SCREEN
dialogues.text: One of the Divers turns to the worm's camera. He SPEAKS i diving helmet's microphone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through speaker)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's titanium. we can't cut through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stamper turns to Harmsway:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do it. HARMSWAY (into microphone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divers, stand aside.

dialogues.speaker: UNDERWATER
dialogues.text: The worm moves into position to grind through the hatch. cover slides over the lens, and the grinder whorls into l CLOSER ON THE WORM - The grinder stalls for an instant as encounters the titanium bars. STILL CLOSER - One of the URANIUM GRINDING TEETH SNAPS OF the titanium, and starts to grind through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once past the bars, the grinder cuts easily through the s Trapped air bursts out from inside the compartment. The D the worm to one side; two of them enter the hold with lig worm follows. The two other divers remain behind to feed flexible tubing through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Divers' lights illuminate the hold: STACKS OF GOLD BA as the eye can see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harmsway looks at the video screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen: I do believe we've struck gold... Four minutes ahead of schedule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The worm closes its "eye", revs up its grinders, and atta first pile of gold Bars. It runs through them like butter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bloodletting and recriminations have begun. This play

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One-third of the British gold reserves?!? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of idiot loses - (looks to the treasury officer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? The equivalent of ten billion US dollars???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sheepishly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give or take. Depending on today's currency rates -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell was the gold doing on that boat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were bringing it back from Hong Kong. Under orders from the Treasury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During the cold war, we stored a third in America, and another third in Hong Kong - in case of a nuclear attack. And with the turn-over of Hong Kong to the Chinese -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why wasn't the ship protected?!?! Why was it sailing without radar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I resent your tone, sir. I have men who are missing -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I have the entire British economy to worry about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breaking in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Minister - (all turn to him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously, MI-6 was not involved in this operation. But I have to defend the Admiral. Roebuck looks at Bond with great surprise. Bond continues BOND (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Electronic silence was the safest way to move that gold. Otherwise, any country - or individual - with the crudest missile could just lock onto our signals, and take out the boat. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what happened to the Sheffield in the Falklands. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since then, it's standard operating procedure for any sensitive shipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frowns)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least we know where the gold is. When are the recovery ships due?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 36 hours. They've already sailed from the Persian gulf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I expect to have that gold recovered in 36 hours. Until then, I'm imposing my own electronic silence: For the sake of the economy, not a word to NATO, the press, the CIA. (beat, looking at:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And so long as Commander Bond here seems to be such an expert on these matters, I want him to go along as an observer. Are we agreed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you wish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harmsway walks along the side of the ship, observing the The WORM'S DREDGING PUMP sucks up the ground-up GOLD AND RY, (through the TUBE hanging over the side,) and dumps i SERIES OF SLUICES. At each stage the gold nuggets fall to of the sluice, and excess water flows off the side of the

dialogues.speaker: AT THE STERN HOLD -
dialogues.text: where all the water has been drained off, leaving a casca nuggets pouring into the ship's hold - HARMSWAY reaches into the shimmering cascade, and takes a of gold. He sees Stamper approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember the golden rule, Mr. Stamper: He who has the gold, rules. He drops the gold back in the hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the helicopter ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fueled and waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. We have an appointment in Hong Kong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M and Bond, striding down a hallway to exit the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You're turning into quite the politician, 007.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have an excellent teacher. (sideways glance)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Make sure you wear the uniform'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring his jibe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you make of all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't quite add up. They've come to a door. Pause as he opens it. He explains

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The infrared satellite images. No heat, no flame, no explosion. If that boat went down where they said it did, there should have been some residual heat reading on the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sabotage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A three-thousand ton frigate doesn't just vanish into thin air. She nods and pushes through the door. He follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've already contacted our station in Kuala Lumpur. They're lining up a local contact. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to find that gold, and secure it. They've arrived at her car. The door is already open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Didn't Elliot Harmsway just move his headquarters to Kuala Lumpur? She turns, freezes Bond with a look:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Contrary to what you may believe, 007, the world is not filled with mad-men who can hollow out volcanoes, stock them with big-breasted women, and threaten the world with nuclear annihilation. Bond reacts to the comeuppance. She continues: M (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The case is closed. The Italian authorities ruled the girl a suicide. We had enough trouble keeping your name out of the media. For everyone's sake - (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your job is to find the gold. Not settle some personal score with Elliot Harmsway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Super: HONG KONG. Harmsway's helicopter is perched atop t tinker-toy-styled building in the Central district.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CHINESE CHOP comes down firmly on a legal document. GEN the People's Revolutionary Army) is seated with a squad o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that is the fifth document. With your counter-signature, the sale will be complete. The document is passed across to HARMSWAY, sitting with h counsel. One of the men is WHISPERING TO HIM, INTENSELY:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure? If we waited - Harmsway waves the lawyer off, silencing him. Addresses t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Li: My young associate here has just informed me that if I waited a year, I could perhaps receive a higher price for this building. (beat, wryly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has great faith in Hong Kong. As did my ancestors. With obvious results. Nervous chuckles around the table, but the General is res HARMSWAY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yet to sell this building for more money - to profiteer - would run counter to the Chinese sprit of guanchi - mutual trust and obligation; it would violate the ancient principles of feng shui - (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - the reason we sign five documents instead of an unlucky four, and why this building has a fifth, non-functioning ventilation shaft on its roof. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wind and water, fire and rain, earth and sky - feng shui. All things - at one, in balance, with nature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Most eloquently put, Sir Elliot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, General Li. Now I'll just sign this last document - He puts the pen to the paper, and BREAKS THE PEN. Alarmed HARMSWAY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terribly sorry. Mr. Stamper? From behind, Stamper hands him a pen. Harmsway innocently sign in RED INK -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir Elliot! Red ink -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course! How foolish. More bad luck. I'll just borrow yours - He takes General Li's pen, and signs his name with a flou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the whirring blades of the chopper, Harmsway bids f General Li. He and Stamper get in helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER -
dialogues.text: As Harmsway waves good-bye from the window, the helicopte REVEALING a METAL CABLE attached to the LANDING SKID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cable leads to a spool, which runs to the FIFTH METAL SHAFT Harmsway referred to in the last scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harmsway pops open a bottle of champagne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old Chinese toast to our friends...

dialogues.speaker: RETURN ON ROOFTOP HELIPAD -
dialogues.text: The General SEES THE CABLE GROW TAUT AROUND THE VENTILATI He reacts with horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harmsway glances down to watch the VENTILATION SHAFT TOPP General and his aides, scattering them like rats. In the chopper, the pilot cuts the cable, and Harmsway li champagne glass:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confusion to the enemy. In 48 hours, that building - and all of Hong Kong around it - will cease to exist.

dialogues.speaker: SKIES ABOVE STRAIT OF MALACCA
dialogues.text: A BRITISH MILITARY C-130 airship is dropping sono-buoys i water from a low altitude. me plane veers off, revealing SEA KING command and control helicopter, hovering above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond holds a map of the channel. He's standing over sever seated at radar, sonar, and navigation consoles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounding: Bottom is thirty fathoms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Negative bounce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should be right over it. They hear a SHARP DINGING SOUND -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait - I'm getting something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where? What is it? The man points at one of the screens, where Bond sees a C GENERATED MAP OF THE SEA FLOOR, with the FAINT OUTLINE of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not sure yet - He types in some commands on a keyboard, and a 3-D render boat appears on another computer screen. Lots of data:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shinjuku. Japanese troop carrier. World War II.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's make another pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have traffic on the deck - They look down and see an HNN (Harmsway News Network) boa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get rid of them. NEW ANGLE - EXT. SEA RING CHOPPER & HNN BOAT - The chopper hovers above the HNN boat - PILOT (on pa speaker)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please leave the area. please leave the area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're looking up at the world's tallest building: The 150 Petronas Towers. (They look like an architectural collabo between Friz Lang and H.G. Wells.) At the 50th floor, the bridge connecting the buildings, where -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliot Harmsway strides out of an elevator (in Tower 1,) of waiting assistants. Without breaking stride -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning Sir Elliot! Welcome to Kuala Lumpur -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, morning all. What have we got? His EXECUTIVE SECRETARY rushes to keep up, reading from a they cross the sky bridge to HNN's main reception area, i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Canadian Prime Minister wants to set a lunch -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pencil it in for the next trip -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The American presidential candidate called to complain about that sex story -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send him a $10,000 campaign contribution, and explain I have no control over what my journalists write -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your bankers want an answer about the Brazilian TV stations

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Queen invited you to dinner -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the 9:30 news meeting is waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent. They've passed from the bridge, through reception, into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glass conference roam, whose PARTIALLY CLOSED BLINDS ob view of the MAMMOTH HNN NEWS CENTER. (We'll see this, in later.) Meanwhile, a DOZEN RAMBUNCTIOUS EDITORS react to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, all my golden retrievers. What kind of havoc shall we create in the world today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - A ferry sank and burned in Pakistan; 457 dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: American jetliner down in Omaha -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Economic summit ends in Tokyo -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boring -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riots broke out at the World Cup soccer finals -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dog bites man. (explains)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man bites dog is a news story. Riots at the World Cup soccer finals is a social announcement. Next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This just came in: There's something up with the British Navy in the Strait. Rescue planes, helicopters; two ships supposedly sailing from the Persian gulf. They just chased away one of our news boats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feigning complete innocence)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sounds like a plane went down or something... Either way, they're calling it - all together now:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "A routine training exercise."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm shocked!! Issue the usual vehement protest: Freedom of the press, people's right to know... Lather it up with a lot of righteous indignation. (off their laughter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frowning, Bond peers at the Sonar Operator's screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still nothing? The operator shakes his head. The pilot calls back from t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander Bond: They've found one of the crewman's bodies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sea King comes in above several police cars and boats jumps the last ten feet, and the chopper peels off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo! Jimbo! Bond turns to look: It's JACK WADE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade, what the hell are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not here, ol' buddy. The CIA has absolutely no knowledge of the missing ship, the missing gold, where it was going, or when it left Hong Kong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's reassuring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey - the world is my office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's take a look at the body. As Bond moves off, WADE SNIFFS THE AIR, savoring the arom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smells like... Coffee plants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A POLICEMEN pulls a white sheet from the body. (We don't Bond and Wade look down at something gruesome:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colorful... Shark attack? Bond shakes his head grimly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so. The veins are cauterized - as if they were sealed by heat... (beat, confounded)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there are no burn marks on the flesh. It doesn't make sense. (to the policeman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who found the body?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points to)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dato. Local fisherman. Says it came in with the tide early this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask him if it could have washed in from the west side of the Strait. The POLICEMAN has an animated conversation with FISHERMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He says it's not possible. The current could have only brought the body in from the east.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Wade)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a boat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if you'd call it a boat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something with an engine? Not oars?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step into my office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smashing through the water at breakneck speed. Wade and B over the engines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want with the Harbor Master?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tide and current charts. Work backward from the body - find where the ship sank. (Wade nods appreciatively)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you get the boat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seized it from a guy smuggling computer chips out of Bangkok. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should have seen his rose garden: Blooms the size of hand grenades. Bond looks at Wade: The man remains, forever deranged.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The Harbor Master's tower overlooks a small armada of yac boats, etc. A series of long dockways jut out into the ha

dialogues.speaker: CIGARETTE BOAT
dialogues.text: Wade's boat is moving slowly along the waterway at the en docks. Looking off, Bond spots the Harbor Master's Tower:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over there. Wade turns the boat down one of the dock channels.

dialogues.speaker: WADE/BOND'S POV
dialogues.text: A SLEEK LAUNCH is ROARING TOWARDS them, on a dead collisi A WOMAN in a baseball cap is at the wheel. WADE pulls his boat to the right; the LAUNCH ROARS AROUND rocking the cigarette boat with its wake. BOTH BOND and WADE clock the woman - who we will later le SIDNEY WINCH. Wade stares after her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I've just seen my next future ex-wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seeing they're about to crash)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if you kill us first - unless that's how you plan to leave Muffy. Wade scowls, setting the boat back on course.

dialogues.speaker: DOCKSIDE
dialogues.text: Bond hops off the boat, securing the lines. Wade joins hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, Jimbo - whatever happened to that girl - in Cuba - ? Finished tying the boat, they walk toward the Harbor Mast

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Russian Minister of Transportation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She married a hockey player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I envy your 'undercover' assignments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a look, then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We work in the dark. We do what we can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The local Malay harbor master puts a stack of charts on t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wind, tide, currents... You're the second person today asked for a full set of charts. (holds out a clipboard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you'd just sign here - Bond takes the clipboard - INSERT CLIPBOARD - read signature: SIDNEY WINCH. Bond returns the clipboard:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. (apparent afterthought)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way - was there anything strange the night before last? Odd weather, lost boats - ??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... Unless you're talking about the bus problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Bus problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Cheong's ferry was late. He runs the line across the Strait between here and Sumatra. The lumber mill workers coming back for the weekend missed the last bus. Slept on the docks. Hundreds of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond emerges, carrying the charts, along with Wade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to get these to London. Do you know this Captain Cheong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spends his nights at the Kuala Lumpur yacht club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you arrange a meeting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell. The CIA built that club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Palm trees, torch lights, and Rolls Royces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A local band plays on the verandah. We find Wade at a POK with five local Malay Chinese. He CUTS THE CARDS, exubera

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay gentlemen. The name of the game is 7-card Cambodian stud. Everything is wild! And then - moving through a beaded glass curtain - we fin white dinner jacket, sitting with CAPTAIN CHEONG. The Cap elegant, mid-5O's, eye patch. (To be put into local diale

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the Strait of Malacca, when a boat is even five minutes late, one begins to worry, Mr. Bond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Pirates from Sumatra want the cargo; smugglers from Thailand and Burma want the ships.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes kill the crew; other times - (points to his eye)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Torture them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kuala Lumpur ferry was 35 miles off-course that night. Captain blamed the auto-pilot; I suspected he was drunk - until the Sumatra ferry captain had same problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you test the auto-pilots? The satellite positioning receiver?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next morning. Both boats. Nothing wrong. (chuckles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My 90 year old grandfather thinks 'Ghost in the computer - Silicon Dragon.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles, standing to leave)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate your time -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should talk to Sidney Winch. Owns a marine salvage company. Nobody knows more about the Strait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where can I find him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Him? He, is a she - (points)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: THE BAR -
dialogues.text: SIDNEY WINCH, about 32, tough, smart, and (here's a surpr beautiful, is ordering a drink when Bond appears:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bourbon. Neat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder if you handle your liquor more carefully than you handle your boat. Very slowly, Sidney turns to Bond. She looks him up and d deciding whether this specimen is worth her time. Her con definite - though skeptical - maybe. She gives him a sult

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes, you just have to plunge into things. Be reckless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - And I bet you always leave turmoil in your wake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking, 'not bad')

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have we met?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This afternoon. Our boats practically kissed in the harbor. (holds out his hand to shake)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James Bond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney Winch. The BARTENDER APPEARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vodka martini, shaken not stirred. (to Sidney)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And another for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But you can buy a drink for my friend, Taro. She steps back REVEALING a huge SAMOAN, TARO, wearing a d tie, sitting on a stool. Taro smiles menacingly at Bond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaperone. I'm waiting for my dinner date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pity. (to Bartender)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring him whatever he wants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what brings you to Kuala Lumpur, Mr. Bond? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait - don't tell me: Unhappy marriage? Running from some poor little girl with two kids and a Chanel pocketbook in - London? Bond analyzes the situation: 1) She's with a thug. 2) She salvage. 3) She went to the Harbor Master's office for th 4) She's a smart-ass. He decides to see if he can rattle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I'm here on business. You might say it was a... Golden opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a chill in her voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And exactly what business are you in, Mr. Bond?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Insurance. Lloyds of London.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (daggers in her voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Strait can be a very dangerous place, Mr. Bond. A few words scribbled on a piece of paper in London doesn't carry a lot of value out here. Including life insurance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll keep that in mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see my date is here. (to Taro)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I think Mr. Bond is ready to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to run into you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not make it a habit. She exits. Turning his back on Taro, Bond watches her cro room. Taro places a huge hand on Bond's shoulder -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you should go -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not quite yet, Taro - And from BOND'S POV - Sidney greets HARMSWAY with a big h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Elliot!! Watching this, Bond seethes with memory of Paris and his Harmsway. Taro tightens his grip -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said you should - But before he finishes, Bond spins, and: 1) slams Taro's bar, 2) snatches the ice-pick from the bartender, 3) yank ward by his collar, 4) slams the ice-pick through Taro's wooden bar, and 5) kicks the stool out from under the goo Taro is now hanging by his tie, from the bar, choking. Bond takes a moment to straighten his own bow-tie. Wade a jubilant, with a wad of cash:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo! Jimbo! I won five hundred - (seeing Taro)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tied one on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond walks down a long dock towards a lone boat, moored a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond looks around furtively, before climbing aboard the s going craft. On the aft-deck, there's a large covered obj As Bond reaches for the CABIN DOOR, it opens by itself - succession of THREE YOUNG ENGLISH WOMEN in STRING BIKINIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling back into the cabin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's arrived. Bond turns from the door to watch the women. He hears:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're late 007. I've been expecting you. Q emerges from the cabin in a blazer and an ascot. He's i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Q! How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Retired. I'm not getting paid to help you save the world anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. It was a national emergency -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That hardly makes up for the imposition. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, for what I hope will be the very last time - pay attention, 007. (he unfurls a map:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First, computer generated retrograde analysis map. Body here, meteorolog- ical influences here, likely vector- ing of the ship's coordinates here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea of what any of that means? In English?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a clue. I didn't lose the ship. (reaches for a Filofax sized device)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next, your new personal communicator. (flips it open)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picture-phone, fax, beeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I have to dial '9' to get out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care who you dial, so long as it's not me. Next - Q walks to the large object on the aft-deck. Pulls off a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your new car. (Insert name)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Four wheel drive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. And do try to keep all four of them on the road. (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the usual refinements: Smoke, missiles, machine guns - (shows him a key fob)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fully operational remote control. Drives forward, reverse - (Bond presses a button, opening a window)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop that! (grabbing it away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plus infrared thermal imaging radar, heads up instrumentation, and 17 beverage cup holders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... 17 Beverage cup holders?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standard equipment. The world's automobile manufacturers seem to be in some kind of mad war to see who can provide the most beverage cup holders. Bond nods, and LOOKS AT a distraction from the GIRLS IN B

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must say, Q, you seem to be doing rather well in your retirement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't even think about it. 007. They're my granddaughters.

dialogues.speaker: STRAIT OF MALACCA
dialogues.text: Clear skies and blue water. The only vessel in sight is a five foot SPORT FISHING BOAT underway at full throttle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade at the helm; Bond next to him, near sonar, holding Q

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow down. We're close. Wade pulls back on the throttle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boat starts a wide turn -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we're back at the outcropping where the Indomitable s SPORT FISHING BOAT is trolling against a background of sa and the lush green hills of Sumatra.

dialogues.speaker: FLYING BRIDGE -
dialogues.text: Wade scans the shore; Bond studies the sonar display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno, Jimbo. It can't be out here. How could they get this far off course?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concentrating on the sonar)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knows? Fog, night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'd never sail this close to the shore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute - (beat, pointing to the screen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got it. There! Off the port bow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The murky electronic outline of a ship.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE -
dialogues.text: Bond watches the sonar screen. Wade slows engines, consul

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut the engines! It's about two- hundred fifty feet down.

dialogues.speaker: AN ANCHOR BEING PITCHED INTO THE WATER
dialogues.text: By Wade. Bond is strapping on his scuba tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-fifty's pretty deep for air. You should really be using mixed gases. Bond glances at the air gauge on his tanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make a bounce dive. If I can keep my bottom time short, I'll be all right. Bond gathers up FLARES, and sits on the gunwale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (only half teasing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your eye out for pirates. Wade pulls back his shirt to reveal TWO SIX-SHOOTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got you covered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's reassuring. Bond rolls backward into the water and disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond swims to the anchor line, and begins pulling himself handover-hand, deeper and deeper into a monochromatic glo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond touches down by the anchor; his fins kick up the san Checking his wrist compass, he sets off through a rocky c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahead, in the dimness, a huge gray shape looms out of the Bond lights a FLARE, and the scene is suddenly alive with From Bond's position, the hull seems to go on forever bef lost beyond range of his flare. Bond checks his air gauge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depth: 283 feet - Air capacity: 3/4 tank remaining.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE -
dialogues.text: Bond swims to the hole in the side of the Indomitable. He study the damage. Then enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond sees the damage on the passageway door. Swims throug

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flare throws eerie shadows along the corridor; Bond s busted bilge-hold hatch. Again, he pauses to examine the by the worm. He drops into the hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gold is gone. Bond swims a few yards in: Nothing. A v space. Bond's flare sputters and dies. He drops it, light As he turns to exit, SOMETHING GLINTS on the deck below t He moves toward it.

dialogues.speaker: CLOSER -
dialogues.text: A half-chewed GOLD BAR is wedged between a brace and the Bond reaches for it, feeling the worm's drill marks on th Just as he yanks the bar out, a MORAY EEL lashes out from brace, baring its teeth. Still clutching the gold bar, Bond jumps back, and shoots

dialogues.speaker: PASSAGE WAY -, (INT. INDOMITABLE)
dialogues.text: where he collides with something floating just below the Dropping the flare on the impact, Bond twists around to s THE FACE OF A FLOATING DEAD SAILOR.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE -
dialogues.text: Throwing wildly gyrating shadows, the flare drops to the ing under some debris. Regaining his composure, Bond SLIP BAR INTO A WEBBED SACK ON HIS BELT, then moves to retriev

dialogues.speaker: HATCH/DECK -
dialogues.text: Bond reaches for the flare, under a section of the torn h He notices the BROKEN URANIUM GRINDING TOOTH. He picks it it into his sack, and swims off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond swims to the anchor line, grabs hold, and starts up. way, he glances at his gauges:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depth: 160 feet - Air capacity: below RED LINE - empty. T light level on the gauges suddenly DARKENS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black HULL has blotted out the light... And SOMETHING L HEAVY IS FALLING straight at 007.

dialogues.speaker: BOND -
dialogues.text: kicks away from the anchor-line just as a 1000 POUND ANCH by. He looks up again: THREE DIVERS ARE IN THE WATER. One carries a strange-looking HARPOON-TYPE GUN; another t CABLE. The divers have fanned out, looking for 007.

dialogues.speaker: BOND -
dialogues.text: Realizes his best chance is to take one of the men hostag Flashing his KNIFE, Bond cuts the cord to his gold/uraniu STUFFS THE SACK INTO HIS BAGGY SWIM TRUNKS. Bond rockets up, SLAMMING INTO DIVER #1. A confusion of b And just as Bond overcomes the man - spinning him around, knife to the diver's throat - DIVER #2 SHOOTS the HARPOON-TYPE GUN, and A DOLPHIN NET e ENVELOPING BOND AND THE DIVER in a mesh. (Note: This is a 'fish friendly' research tool.) Diver #3 HOOKS THE CABLE he's been trailing onto the net,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The net erupts through the surface, is hauled up into the deposited on - THE DECK OF A SELF-PROPELLED SALVAGE BARGE. (An old scow, with a large crane, two-story deck-house, a whose idea of 'cruise-wear' runs to tattoos and grotesque

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH HIS DIVING MASK -
dialogues.text: As the water drains from his mask, Bond sees the mesh bei away, and FIVE GOONS come into focus, training AUTOMATIC him. (Bond still has the diver from behind, knife to his One of the goons reaches forward, ripping off Bond's mask

dialogues.speaker: TARO
dialogues.text: Brandishing an UZI at Bond, with a malevolent smile:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uzi beats knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Interesting point. Bond sticks the knife into the deck, and releases the hos

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him up. Take his belt. (motioning to Wade)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the two of them to the Captain. The men grab Bond roughly, and shove him next to Wade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way. I almost forgot. (smashing Bond)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I owed you one. Bond and Wade are frog-marched to the bridge, passing und of various cutthroat crew members. Wade is completely unf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sniffs the air)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smell that Jimmy? Sea Kelp. Bond gives Wade a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey - it could be worse. At least they speak English. Bond glances up at a crew member, SHARPENING A MACHETE, s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Somehow, that's not reassuring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're back in Bond-land: A high-tech control room, with l monitors and white-suited TECHNICIANS. Bond and Wade are through the-door, followed by Taro and the two goons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here they are, Captain. The "Captain" turns from a monitor: IT'S SIDNEY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give me one goad reason - Mister Bond, from Lloyds of London - why I shouldn't kill both of you, burn your boat, and use your bodies for shark bait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chirping up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you two know each other!?! Small world, ain't it? What happened? Commitment problems?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney Winch, meet -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack Wade. Citibank. Commercial loan division. If you're ever lookin' for a sweet refinance on the boat -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Wade)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to excuse Miss Winch: She thinks she's on a 'seduce and destroy' mission through life... (pauses)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...But she won't kill us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. First, because I don't think it's in your nature. And second, because there's no gold down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So charming! So suave! (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't insult me. I'm not one of your 'little London girls' who falls for the lies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it was commitment!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every wharf-rat from here to Hong Kong knows what's on that boat and I'm claiming it. One-third of that gold is mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fine, but - even a little London girl knows that one third of nothing is still nothing. There's a flicker of doubt in her eyes. She turns to Taro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was he carrying anything? Taro holds up the BOND'S DIVING BELT, indicating 'nothing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Search him. The men look at Bond - wearing only swim trunks. Nobody m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I have to do everything around here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope so. Frowning, Sidney moves to Bond. As she REACHES INTO HIS T cut to THEIR FACES. THEIR EYES ARE LOCKED ON EACH OTHER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you'll be gentle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think about mom. BOND WINCES. She's goosed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Unusual technique. Returning to the WIDE SHOT, she opens the sack. SHOWS THE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what do you call this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - The family jewels? She scowls, takes out the URANIUM TOOTH. Looks at it, bla holds it out to a TECHNICIAN, who examines it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I don't know. I'm not sure - Just then, a CREWMAN BURSTS IN:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss! We got company - comin' up off the starboard bow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exiting, to Taro)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring them. Taro motions with his Uzi for Bond and Wade to follow... But BOND hesitates, LOOKING BACK AT THE TECHNICIAN with t 007 wants to get it, but Taro nudges him out with the gun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BRITISH NAVAL CUTTER is pulling alongside the barge - S WAILING, crew members in battle gear, FORWARD GATLING GUN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on bullhorn)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attention sea barge: Lay down your weapons, and prepare to be boarded. ON THE BARGE - Sidney and Co. stand, weapons ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Repeat: Lay down your weapons, and prepare to be boarded. Bond turns to Sidney, who's grabbed a bullhorn of her own

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I were you -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - You're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as she hoists the bullhorn)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just remember: They think there's ten billion dollars in gold down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. (clicks it on, and:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Now hear this: Drop dead." Bond and Wade exchange an amused/helpless glance - as if know what's coming next. There's a pause, then -

dialogues.speaker: THE CRUISER'S GATLING GUN ERUPTS WITH AN EARDRUM-SHATTERI
dialogues.text: It's only a warning shot, but - EVERYONE ON THE BARGE DIVES FOR THE DECK... Except for Bo Wade, who might as well be having tea. Bond looks down at cowering on the boards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gatling gun beats Uzi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ARMED BOARDING PARTY is coming across an aluminum brid extended from the Cutter onto the barge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a tiny popinjay)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's in charge here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am. What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have precisely one minute to pull up your anchor and be under way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. No way. I got here first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Wade?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be me -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snidely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for your message. (turns to)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're Bond?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guard! Arrest these men! Escort them to the cutter! Bond and Wade are stunned. The Marines move in. Bond stru

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get them out of here. If he says one word, shoot him. As TWO MARINES with automatic rifles take Bond and Wade a folding bridge -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (demanding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Morton. Pause. She expects him to ask "And yours?" but he doesn't

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Sidney Winch, and -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for you, Miss Winch. You now have exactly 30 seconds to get this rust bucket out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furiously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know my rights. These are international waters. The British Navy abandoned that boat, and I'm claiming it. Under international law, I have the right to salvage what's on that wreck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteen seconds. Perhaps you should consider hiring an attorney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was an attorney!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm. I suppose this is a step above that profession. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten seconds. Are you leaving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You leave me no alternative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (upholstering a walkie-talkie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut her anchor. As Sidney yells "NO!" - THE FORWARD GATLING GUN erupts to short, bone rattling burst CUTS THE CHAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't get away with this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stepping onto the bridge)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-day, Miss Winch. I advise you to get some steam up - before you run aground. As she floats away, Sidney calls out to the Captain, Bond

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bastards! Believe me - you haven't heard the last of me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond, Wade and the Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Nice trick with the arrest. Very convincing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no trick, Mr. Wade. I've got half a mind to throw both of you in the brig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think you're overreacting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with great sarcasm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. The famous James Bond. I've heard all about you, sir. You were under direct orders to act as an observer - and yet you had to go off, on your own, like some half-assed CIA cowboy - (Wade reacts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Endangering the gold, attracting that lunatic woman, and then putting in a distress call for us to save your bloody hide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Calmly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...That's all well and good, Captain, save for one thing: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no gold down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? We went through all this and the ship isn't even down there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, the ship is down there. But the gold is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's absurd! It took two squads of forty men fifteen days to load that gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what I saw -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care what you think you saw. You're a damned amateur. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get off my ship. Go back to your trench-coats and your code names - and leave the job to professionals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exchanges a glance with Wade, then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye-aye, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Bond and Wade push away from the Naval Cutter:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where to now, Jimbo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not certain... But I think there's someone I want to press for some answers in Kuala Lumpur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond'- car travels through the tropical landscape, turnin for Kuala Lumpur.

dialogues.speaker: COASTAL ROADWAY
dialogues.text: As Bond downshifts in anticipation of an upcoming hill, h RINGS. Before answering it, he looks down at:

dialogues.speaker: DASHBOARD
dialogues.text: Displayed on separate lines:, "INCOMING CALL." "ORIGIN: ( runs through numbers until it hits on) 763-4733." "NAME: UNKNOWN. "STATUS: (blinking) SECURE."

dialogues.speaker: RETURN ON BOND -
dialogues.text: Reacting - the information is curious. Bond picks up the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Mister Bond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with an edge)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harmsway is perched on a desk. In the background, THROUGH OFFICE DOOR, we can see Harmsway's EXECUTIVE SECRETARY se someone coffee from a SILVER TRAY - but we can't see who

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliot Harmsway! I heard you were in K.L. and thought we might get together for a chat...

dialogues.speaker: RETURN ON BOND
dialogues.text: HARMSWAY (Cont'd, O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We seemed to get off on the wrong foot back there in Venice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you get this number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, please, Mr. Bond. We live in the information age! Information is currency - and with the right currency, you can have any piece of information. (Bond reacts, sourly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides I own the phone company. What do you say? Twenty minutes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on my way. Bond hangs up, and drives with renewed determination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harmsway hangs up; STAMPER is standing nearby. Harmsway t concerned glance at his office, then turns to Stamper:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's find out exactly what he knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond's car approaches the camera, passes it, and heads fo TOWERS, looming over Kuala Lumpur in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond's car passes the front of the building, and drives d into an underground car park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passing NEWSPAPER LOADING DOCKS (with trucks displaying b "TOMORROW" and "HNN" logos, and HUM-VEES used by building Bond pulls into the VALET AREA - Where a cheerful YOUNG PR WOMAN and VALET wait. Both wear colorful BLAZER used by all Harmsway Building service per

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
