dialogues.text: (from inside the car)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James Bond to see Elliot Harmsway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I'm to bring you right up. The valet will take your car -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd prefer to park it myself. (off her questioning look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Temperamental. Practically has a mind of its own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't they all? She points to a spot near the loading docks. Bond drives

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond backs into the space, thinking about the (inevitable away. He looks through the windshield, surveying the area

dialogues.speaker: UNDERGROUND CAR PARK -
dialogues.text: TWO BURLY SECURITY GUARDS (in Harmsway Blazers,) stand be bulletproof security desk. There's a METAL DETECTOR by th

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE, (INT. BOND'S CAR)
dialogues.text: Reaching inside his jacket, Bond REMOVES HIS GUN, and HID compartment under the dashboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PR WOMAN joins Bond as he locks the car with the REMO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right this way. Following her through the metal detector, Bond scans the devices at the guard's desk: Lots of cameras, sensors, an

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond and the PR Woman step off an escalator onto an open GLASS WINDOWS looking down into a mammoth NEWSPAPER PRINT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving to a door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Harmsway is checking the afternoon editions. If you'll just follow me -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NOISE FROM THE PRINTING PRESSES is deafening. Bond an WOMAN walk down a METAL STAIRCASE to the pressroom floor, Harmsway (wearing a printer's smock and newsprint cap,) i with SEVERAL PRESSMEN - a fresh issue of "Tomorrow" outst his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spotting Bond, yelling:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Bond! Nice to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir Elliot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come. Let's get out of the noise. (escorting Bond off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - I'll give you a tour of the building, then we'll talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harmsway is hanging up his smock in the short hallway tha the press room to an elevator. There's a SINK in the room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's funny, Mr. Bond. Of all the things I own, nothing gives me as much enjoyment as my newspapers. He moves to the sink to wash his hands. Turns on the fauc HARMSWAY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ironic, isn't it? In the age of TV, I still can't get the ink out of my veins. Bond SMILES WRYLY, looking at Harmsway hunched over the s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... A man with ink in his veins, and blood on his hands. Harmsway smiles to himself, acknowledging the jibe... But ignore it. He turns off the faucet, dries his hands -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We print 31 newspapers here; another two-hundred-and-seventy at satellite plants around the world. He pulls on his ВЈ2000 Saville Row suit-jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And how many of those newspapers carried Paris Harmsway's obituary? Harmsway turns, and presses the ELEVATOR BUTTON. The door instantly. HE SMILES:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of them, Mister Bond... (motioning inside)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors close. Bond clocks the security camera in the c Harmsway is about to take great delight in making Bond sq

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before I became involved with Paris, she was always involved with the most inappropriate' men... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Playboys. Thrill seekers. Middle aged Peter Pans who only brought out the worst in her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to save her. But she remained a manic depressive: Fits, inappropriate behavior... Delusions of grandeur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder if it runs in the family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bursts out in a laugh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only difference between a psychopath and a genius, Mr. Bond, is the degree of success. He looks up at the digital readout, going from 40 to 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still, I do miss her. I only wish she could have lived to see all this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can feel your pain. The doors open:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way - what is it that brings you to Kuala Lumpur, Mister Bond?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sightseeing. Harmsway motions for Bond to exit. They step out into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A short hallway lined with OIL PORTRAITS of Harmsway's an Double doors at both ends. (People passing through.) As t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I call this the Rogue's gallery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I can see: You've hung the rest of your relatives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to the first portrait)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My third great Uncle - the Earl of Aberdeen - negotiated the purchase of Hong Kong from the Chinese. (moving to)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His son-in-law - George Harmsway - made the first family fortune, running opium into Shanghai... (moving to)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His son, Thomas, who lost it, smoking the opium... And my grandfather Henry, who opened the first telegraph station, and published the colony's first English newspaper. (pausing, wistfully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a city of unlimited possibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why did you leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it's a dying city. Since the Chinese take-over, who knows what can happen tomorrow? (moving to the last two portraits)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In any case, this is my father, Charles: A royal bastard who started the first radio and television stations. Said I'd never amount to anything, but... (passing his own portrait)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I turned it into this He pushes through a door, into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cavernous THREE STORY ROOM bristling with activity. At is the main HNN ANCHOR DESK, (where a news broadcast is i surrounded by scores of reporter's desks a la CNN. Around the perimeter of the room are VARIOUS TV STUDIOS l on Kuala Lumpur. All are broadcasting: A Larry King-type MTV; SPORTS; a KITCHEN where a chef is preparing somethin With its walls of monitors, equipment, and control rooms, is overwhelming. Harmsway will walk Bond around the perim

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to the new world order, Mr. Bond. (starting to walk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Churchill had his armies; Caesar had his legions; I have my divisions: (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: News, sports, business, entertainment. And these are my foot soldiers: (a wave of his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2000 people working on 14 floors to feed 300 newspapers, 4 cable news networks, 87 magazines, and 29 different cable TV channels - in 35 languages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And still not a thing to watch. He glances at the SATELLITE CONTROL ROOM, with a NASA-typ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Although it must be fun to have all those satellites.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're merely tools to disseminate information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wryly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or disinformation... If you wanted to, say, beam down a signal to send a ship off course? Maybe one degree a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (guffaws)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fantastic idea Mr. Bond! Perhaps I should buy it for a book! It's totally preposterous, but - (off Bond's reaction)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You amuse me. ...And now perhaps I can amuse you. He stops at a VIDEO TERMINAL. Begins to type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see... First we have this James Bond... I believe he's a field adjuster for Lloyd's of London...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we have this James Bond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading from the screen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Licensed to Kill... (aside)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a bad title for that book... (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or perhaps you'd prefer this James Bond -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who I believe they call "007." Bond is not amused. Harmsway is enjoying himself:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, Mr. Bond, you and I are both men of action. But your era is passing. Words are the new weapons; satellites the new artillery. And make no mistake about it: In the right hands, they can be as deadly as your Walther PPK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Words to live by?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your choice. (glancing at his watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at the time! Come. There's someone I want you meet - about a story I'm thinking of publishing. As they leave, Bond is frustrated by Harmsway's "I don't you think you know - I can crush you" attitude... And now plans (and the operative word here is plans,) to use Bond the one other loose thread in his perfect crime:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DOOR opens and Harmsway enters, followed by Bond. He someone we don't see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, dear. I'm sorry I took so long - REVEAL: SIDNEY is sitting across from his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay, Uncle Ell - She freezes in mid-sentence, seeing Bond. Bond is equally

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is HE doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see you two have met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Briefly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crossing to his desk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't pout, Sidney. I invited him here hoping he might shed some light on your story. He's from 'Lloyd's of London.' (sly glance to Bond)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Aren't you, Mr. Bond?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not going to tell the truth! He was diving for the gold! Harmsway sits, and addresses Bond, matter-of-factly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems - Mr. Bond - that Miss Winch has told me the most incredible story: A sunken British warship filled with gold; a British cutter firing on her; billions of dollars in bullion lying on the bottom of the Strait. Bond isn't enjoying this charade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously, the British government denies all of this -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - I told you! He was there! -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - But as I've explained to Sidney, without proof, there's just no story. Don't you agree Mr. Bond? Before Bond can answer -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I have proof! You ran out of here so fast, I didn't get to show you. Bond and Harmsway react - with entirely different concern wasn't expecting her to have proof; Bond knows that if sh the gold, (or worse, the uranium tooth,) Harmsway will pr both of them to destroy the evidence, and witnesses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (forcing a smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And what's that, my dear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney, perhaps we should leave this to - Sidney cuts Bond off, DROPPING THE GOLD BAR on Harmsway's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He brought that up from the wreck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I see. Alarmed, Bond wants to stop Sidney from reaching into her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney, I wouldn't - Too late. She drops the uranium tooth on his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what about this? Any idea what this is? Silence. Harmsway and Bond exchange a sober look. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I believe it's a depleted uranium drill bit, my dear. HE PRESSES AN ALARM UNDER HIS DESK. Bond reaches for the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we just take these -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blocking him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I want Sir Elliot to keep them. Harmsway stands, comes around the desk:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Well! I do believe this requires further investigation!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Uncle Elliot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No matter what the British government says, I won't kill this story. (his secretary appears in the doorway)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Oxford will show both of you to the elevator... And one of my people will definitely be in touch sooner than later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure they will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-bye, Mister Bond. He reaches to kiss Sidney - and looks in her eyes a secon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-bye, darling. Watching them exit, his smile turns hard and bitter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Executive Secretary escorts them to the elevator, out the PICTURE WINDOW, with its view of the other tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you both for coming in...

dialogues.speaker: EXT. HARMSWAY TOWERS -
dialogues.text: Five floors directly down is the GLASS-ENCLOSED SKY BRIDG above him, he sees TWO WINDOW WASHERS being pulled up on SCAFFOLD.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE -
dialogues.text: A CHIME SOUNDS; the elevator doors open. Bond and Sidney good-byes to the secretary and get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney presses the button for "1". Bond glances at the FL CATOR with reads "55" - clocks the SECURITY CAMERA - and looking for an ESCAPE PANEL. Sidney watches out of the co eye, thinking he's nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing at the security camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Do you have a gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yanking it down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me. A gun? (disabling it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I left mine in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's funny: you struck me as the kind of man who always carries protection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me! I'm a British secret service agent. And we have about two minutes before Harmsway kills both of us. He glances up at the escape panel at the rear of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has anyone ever suggested that you're a paranoid psychotic? Bond ignores the insult, explaining as he moves under the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harmsway sank that ship and stole the gold. It's on the Sea Dolphin II. (boosting himself up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And thanks to your little show and tell - (straining to open the panel)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - giving him the evidence - (popping it open)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're the only ones who can tie him to the crime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliot Harmsway is my Uncle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood or Dutch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was my father's best friend!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's killed closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are seriously deranged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. But why are we going up instead of down? He nods to the FLOOR INDICATOR. She looks: 60, 65, 70. IT Bond reaches down to her -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney, come with me - THE DOORS OPEN. She looks at his outstretched hand with d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if my life depended on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney comes out onto a floor still under construction. T doors CLOSE behind her. To the right, she sees STAMPER an Harmsway-blazered GUARD, with MACHINE PISTOLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God! He's crazy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does he have a gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. On Stamper's reply -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good - He lunges for her, grabs her, spins her around, overwhelm She struggles, yelling:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a mistake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gun against her skull)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! Using Sidney as a HUMAN SHIELD, Stamper marches her in fr closed elevator doors. The guard follows. THEY POSITION T FOR A MASSACRE. Reaching around Sidney, Stamper pulls out STAMPER (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open 14. A beat. It opens. The men unleash a HAIL OF BULLETS, then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car is empty. Stamper perplexed. Pushing Sidney in fr him, he enters the elevator, cautiously... When, suddenly BOND SWINGS DOWN OUT OF THE ESCAPE PANEL (like an athlete bar) FEET FIRST - barely clearing Sidney's head as he KIC and the Guard in their faces. They go flying backwards. Bond jumps down, grabs Sidney -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need a lift? And boosts her into the escape panel, following her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond and Sidney rush forward to the front wall as -

dialogues.speaker: STAMPER AND THE GUARD -
dialogues.text: Recover, grab their guns, move to the threshold, and STAR CEILING WITH GUNFIRE.

dialogues.speaker: ELEVATOR SHAFT -
dialogues.text: Bond presses his body against Sidney, on the front wall, SHIELD HER as BULLETS RIP UP THE FLOOR behind them. With hand, Bond reaches up for the LATCH to open the door abov

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stamper stops shooting. Moves to the rear of the cab, und escape panel. Peers up. Sees nothing. Turns to the Guard:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me up.

dialogues.speaker: ELEVATOR SHAFT -
dialogues.text: Stamper's head pokes up through the hole just as Bond and disappeared into - INT. HALLWAY - (ELEVATOR BANK) - 71ST FLOOR. Squeezing out from between the elevator doors, (which imm close behind them,) Bond and Sidney encounter a group of OFFICE WORKERS, waiting for the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the office workers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I'd try the stairs. As Bond and Sidney scamper off -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rushing out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stairs! (barking into his RADIO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attention all units! They're on the 71st floor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harmsway is striding towards the SECURITY CENTER, RADIO i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stamper! They're not to leave this building alive!

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Moving cautiously toward a CORNER of ANOTHER HALLWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has got to be a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only mistake is that they didn't kill us in the elevator. At the corner, Bond STOPS, SEEING A GUARD, farther down t back to them) CHECKING DOORS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm going with you. Bond frowns, but doesn't have the time to argue. They sta "DUCK AND COVER" in and out of doorways TO SNEAK UP ON HI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harmsway bursts in on GUARDS watching a WALL OF SECURITY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see them - (scanning the monitors)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond and Sidney have just come into frame, sneaking up on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warn him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Porter! They're behind you -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lifting the radio to reply)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger! Over and - BAM. BOND DECKS HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out. Bond kneels, grabs the GUARD'S MACHINE PISTOL, and CLIPS,

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: TWO GUARDS have entered from a STAIRCASE DOOR, hoisting M an instant: (1) Bond lets go a BURST. (2) The Guards SHOO diving for cover in the staircase door. (3) Bond rolls, ( Sidney into an open DOORWAY, and (5) returns A BURST, fro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney is shaken. As Bond stands in the doorway, guarding

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. So it wasn't a mistake. (Bond lets go a blast)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do now? Offer them dinner?!?! Bond glances back at the KITCHEN SUPPLIES. GETS AN IDEA. denly TWISTS, SMASHING the BUTT OF HIS GUN down on some G the counter, then TWISTS BACK, returning a BURST OF GUNFI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here. You shoot. I'll cook. She thinks he's nuts, but squeezes next to him. Handing h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aim that way. Sidney scowls - as Bond moves off-camera - when suddenly, RIP UP THE DOOR FRAME. She jumps, TERRIFIED. Bond looks at her from the PHOTO-COPYING MACHINE, where h OUT the TONER CARTRIDGE. He offers a simple piece of advi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot back! Sidney frowns... Turns... And as she LETS THE GUN RIP, we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stamper, running up steps with the guard. They exit into:

dialogues.speaker: A SHORT SERVICE HALLWAY
dialogues.text: They rush though it, bursting through a door into:

dialogues.speaker: THE ELEVATOR BANK HALLWAY -
dialogues.text: Stamper and the Guard start hunting Bond.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN ON SIDNEY, (HALLWAY/KITCHEN)
dialogues.text: As she continues to exchange fire with the guards... BOND, (having broken the toner cartridge open,) is DUMPIN in a coffee can. He reaches for a BOX of sugar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One second - And (with GUNFIRE SFX over,) Bond sweeps the BROKEN DISH can, and drops his Q LIGHTER in the mix. He moves to Sidney, in the doorway. Kneels. In-between sh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... How did you get into marine salvage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gun burst, then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father left me the business. Bond glances at his watch, timing the bomb. The guards sh shoots back, then explains:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to be a divorce lawyer in New York City. Bond nods, continuing to look at his watch. Glances at he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a lot of difference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? Bond reaches forward to toss the coffee can -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either way, you're taking the goods from dead hulks. He tosses the can, and PULLS HER BACKWARDS, covering her.

dialogues.speaker: THE HALLWAY -
dialogues.text: The GUARDS spring from the door, rushing forward to storm position - just as the COFFEE CAN rolls towards them, and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go - Taking the gun, the two of them start for the door when -

dialogues.speaker: OPPOSITE END OF THE HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Stamper and the GUARD have arrived at the corner, BLASTIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn! Swiftly, Bond grabs a JUG of CLEANER from under the sink, the door, and ROLLS IT DOWN THE HALL in Stamper's directi

dialogues.speaker: STAMPER AND THE GUARD
dialogues.text: Anticipate a bomb. They move back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell does that do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cleans dirt. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond and Sidney BREAK for the STAIRCASE DOOR. (Where the were shooting at them from.) TWISTING AROUND, Bond lets a in Stamper's direction, as he stoops to scoop up one of t guards' MAC-l0's. INSERT - BOND'S BULLETS RIP UP THE JUG OF CLEANER.

dialogues.speaker: STAMPER -
dialogues.text: Cowers, waiting for the jug to blow up... Then realizes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a trick! After him. (into his radio, on the run)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're in the south stairwell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get more men up there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down? Bond leans over the railing. Sees GUARDS coming UP. SHOOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up. They go up about three stairs, and Sidney sees GUARDS des

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shoots, then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up. Bond and Sidney bound up the stairs through a METAL DOOR,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stamper and the Guard bound down the hallway, heading for

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harmsway smiles, watching Bond on a monitor:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And so much for that. (into radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're on the 72nd floor set-back. (explains to the guards)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nowhere to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's magic hour as Bond and Sidney rush out onto the setb sees a WINDOW WASHER'S RIG. And although Sidney asks -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what? Bond's first concern is to make sure Stamper can't get th a pile of CONSTRUCTION EQUIPMENT, he spots a PNEUMATIC NA grabs it, and - BANG. BANG. BANG. He fires 3 NAILS through the door into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That should buy us some time. Now, Bond moves to the WINDOW WASHER'S RIG - a two-man bu scaffold ON TRACKS, with TWO LEATHER SAFETY HARNESSES ins LARGE CABLE SPOOL/MOTOR that stays on the roof. Approaching it, Bond looks over the side:

dialogues.speaker: LOOKING DOWN FROM 72ND FLOOR -
dialogues.text: Twenty stories below is the sky bridge. 50 stories below ground. It's a long, long, way down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me move this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darting up the few steps, Stamper and Guards arrive at th tries to open it. Won't budge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Get the fire ax. One of the guards grabs it from inside a FIRE CABINET. He AX to Stamper, who takes the first SWING AT THE DOOR.

dialogues.text: Bond is positioning the window washer rig. He explains:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll go down close to the sky bridge. We may be able to swing over and use it for cover. As Bond climbs into the bucket, Sidney peers over the sid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. I sail. I do not fly. BANG! Behind them, Stamper's AX HAS JUST PENETRATED THE D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Sometimes, you just have to take the plunge. Bond yanks her in, flips switches on the control pod, and down, as fast as they can go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond and Sidney descend. Tiny specs against the sunset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stamper gives the last few chops to the door. He kicks it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stamper and the guards rush to the ledge.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Bond, looking up - for Stamper - and down - to check thei

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I know is one thing: If we get out of here alive, that gold is mine. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've earned it. Looking upward, Bond SEES STAMPER peering over the rail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One thing at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stamper jumps back from the ledge, enraged. Ax in hand, h the WINDOW WASHING RIG'S MACHINERY - And takes a roundhouse swing at the UNSPOOLING CABLE - bu cutting it, the ax BOUNCES OFF, and the RIG SLIDES ON ITS

dialogues.speaker: THE RIG
dialogues.text: Swings! Sidney SCREAMS - almost falling out. Bond grabs h are now 5 STORIES DIRECTLY ABOVE THE SKY BRIDGE, swaying pendulum - although still descending.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN ON STAMPER
dialogues.text: Having failed at the cable, Stamper goes at the PULLEY fe He swings. Swings again. With each blow, the pulley shaft

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Dropping in VIOLENT SPURTS - just trying to stay in the d

dialogues.speaker: STAMPER
dialogues.text: Finally, the pulley shaft SHATTERS. THE CABLE GRINDS TO A

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND SIDNEY -
dialogues.text: are stopped about 20 feet above the sky bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicked, anxious, fast)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What now? And don't give me some movie clichГ© like 'trust me.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (what the hell)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me. And with this, he turns, and SHOOTS OUT the adjacent WIND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go - But as he starts to climb out - SIDNEY SCREAMS! THE CABLE DROPS THEM 10 FEET LOWER, BELOW THE WINDOW.

dialogues.speaker: THE TERRACE SET-BACK -
dialogues.text: Stamper whacks away at the side of the cable drum. It's c from its moorings.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND SIDNEY -
dialogues.text: look down at the curved glass top of the sky bridge - fac (she thinks) is certain death:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to bounce off that thing! Bond looks up - assuming they have only seconds left befo cuts the cable. HE GRABS HER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on!

dialogues.speaker: TERRACE SET-BACK
dialogues.text: Stamper takes a final swing at the cable drum. With a GRE TERING SOUND it SNAPS FREE OF THE MOORINGS, smashes into and the whole mechanism CAREENS OVER THE SIDE OF THE BUIL

dialogues.speaker: THE WINDOW WASHER'S RIG -
dialogues.text: Bond and Sidney feel the cable give way. They start to fr BOND - FIRES HIS MACHINE PISTOL at the glass top of the s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landing on the deck of the bridge. Bond rolls to his feet Fifty stories of cable from above is falling onto the dec yanks Sidney to the side of the building, just as THE CAB

dialogues.speaker: 72ND FLOOR TERRACE SET-BACK -
dialogues.text: Looking down, Stamper flips open his radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're on the bridge. Seal off the 50th floor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at the monitors)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have hired this man. (to his guards)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get somebody up there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond is moving to the window washer rig debris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the elevators? He steps to the side of the bridge, and looks at the rail inch pipe. Bond begins to work feverishly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We tried that already. Remember? Bond picks up the cable and the leather harnesses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, this is as much your fault as it is mine. Bond is slipping the cable around the railing pipe. One l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney, we don't have time for this - He pulls on the loop to test it. Good enough. Makes a sec

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure! Just when I want to talk - (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that I would have believed you - Bond tests the second loop. He's satisfied. Turns to her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put your back to the railing. Sit up on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doing it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you listening to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put your arms around my neck. Lock your legs around my waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... We have time for that? Just then, GUARDS APPEAR OUT OF FAR ELEVATOR DOOR. Runnin SHOOT. BOND FIRES A BURST BACK as - A NEW ROUND OF BULLET BEGINS TO RAIN DOWN ON THEM FROM ABOVE. BOND LOOKS UP: Stamper has commandeered a second window w rig, and is descending, FIRING AT THEM. Bond looks at Sidney -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes you just have to -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say it. She locks her arms and legs around him, he snaps the leat around her waist, and they roll over the railing Amidst g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond and Sidney fall from the bridge - 50 stories up. They go down, And down, And down -

dialogues.speaker: RETURN ON THE RAILING
dialogues.text: The cable looped around the railing is slowing their desc PAINT ON THE RAILING IS BURNING OFF, and the STEEL itself TO SMOKE from the friction.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Dropping - And Dropping. Looking to the ground, Bond sees the PRESS ROOM OBSERVATI coming up fast from below. It looks like they're going to splattered on the tile floor, when -

dialogues.speaker: RETURN ON THE RAILING
dialogues.text: The cable comes to the end of its run! It DRAGS THE SPOOL BUCKET, and all the other MECHANICS to the side of the br SMASHING AGAINST THE WALL, JAMMING AGAINST THE RAILING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond and Sidney jerk to a halt. They're swinging about fi from the balcony. There's a pause...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this - like - a normal day for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a lousy job, but - (reaching for the balcony)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only reason I stay is for the health benefits. Bond PULLS THEM OVER TO THE BALCONY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stamper lands on bridge. He unbuckles his harness, runs t looks down and sees SIDNEY AND BOND climbing out onto the going for the PRESS ROOM DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're heading for the press room. Stop them!

dialogues.text: Bond and Sidney enter at the top of the metal stairs Bond earlier to meet Harmsway. The Presses are running full blast; the noise is deafenin At the "start" end of the presses - where the paper is fe sees a GIANT ROLL OF NEWSPRINT on a CRANE, about to be lo Directly beyond this is the door to the elevator/wash-up Bond and Harmsway exited earlier. - Coming out of that DOOR, Bond sees THREE GUARDS in Harmsw carrying guns. BOND shoots the HOOK on the CRANE CARRYING THE NEWSPRINT It CRASHES TO THE GROUND, rolling backwards on the guards start scrambling around it - Bond and Sidney race down the stairs, turning in the oppo tion (toward the finishing end of the press, near the gar They encounter a GORILLA-SIZED PRESSMAN, with an oversize Bond and the Pressman square off. Bond tries to get aroun man lifts his crowbar to smash Bond with it. Bond tries t descending crowbar with his gun - but the crowbar snaps i Bond and the Pressman engage in a short, furious fight - each other against the side of the press... Which ends when Bond finally gets the upper hand for a se pushes the man back, into a pile of INK DRUMS. Momentaril Bond forces the man's head into an OPEN INK DRUM - And as he comes up, COVERED WITH INK, gasping for air, Si him on the head with the crowbar. Now, Bond and Sidney take off, toward the garage/exit - But one of the Guards (from the crashing roll of newsprin from between the banks of the printing press, tripping Bo Bond stumbles, face down - then spins over, kicking up at as he comes to finish Bond off. The Guard stumbles backward - Crashing against a NEWSPAPER BALING MACHINE. (A large mac wraps steel or plastic bands around bundles of papers for Rushing the man, Bond struggles with him - and manages to BALING SWITCH - literally tying the man up. The only prob as Bond turns - The LAST GUARD has Sidney in a choke-hold; he's aiming a Seemingly at once, (1) Sidney bites the Guard's forearm, ducks, (3) the Guard shoots wildly, (4) the gun drops, an Bond rushes the man, KNOCKING HIM BACKWARDS INTO THE PRIN pulling Sidney away at the last moment. The Guard is sucked up in the press rollers, and... The pages running through the newsprint web suddenly turn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was bad news. Spotting more Guards coming down the far staircase, Bond and the gun, and runs to the NEWSPAPER DELIVERY CHUTE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down there! They jump into it, sliding down, and around an ALUMINUM C INT. GARAGE - HARMSWAY TOWERS. Bond and Sidney come out near a TROLLEY stacked with news Hearts pounding - having left the pressroom's deafening n they're ready for almost anything, except what they HEAR: The SOUND OF ONE MAN APPLAUDING. A polite, almost bored c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vert, very, good Mr. Bond. Outstanding performance. Harmsway is standing with TEN GUARDS, shoulder to shoulde straight line, all HOLDING WEAPONS on Sidney and Bond. HARMSWAY (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the certain the British taxpayers would be impressed by your efforts. Don't you agree?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think they'd rather know who stole their gold. Harmsway can't help his ego:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chuckles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, I did, of course. It's on the Sea Dolphin II, twenty miles outside of Hong Kong... Not that it will do either of you any good to know. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now both of you: Stand up. And toss the gun out, Mr. Bond. Bond SLIDES THE GUN several feet in front of him... And T TO HIS CAR, noting THE GUARDS ARE LINED UP DIRECTLY IN IT Bond begins to scheme.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Elliot: How could you do this to me? Bond sneaks his hand in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, please, Sidney. There's a hundred billion dollars at stake. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, I never really liked your father that much. He cheated at cards. Bond has removed the CAR REMOTE CONTROL. He palms it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are your guards really going to kill a helpless girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My guards are from South Africa, Mr. Bond. This is their chance to get even with the formerly 'Great' Britain. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now both of you. Put your hands on your heads, and step forward. Holding the remote control, Bond puts his hands on his he manipulating the control into the right position to use i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to buy time)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do, Harmsway? Make some deal with the Chinese government for the gold?.. Was the radioactive uranium I found in Venice part of it? He finally has the remote control in the right position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Questions, questions, Mr. Bond... Which I'm afraid I've neither the time, nor the inclination to answer. (to the guards)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take them out to the jungle and - Suddenly, BOND'S CAR ENGINE STARTS WITH A ROAR. The GUARD shock TOWARDS THE CAR, as: BOND retrieves the gun he slid out, and pulls Sidney behi newspaper trolley, while - THE CAR BEGINS TO MOVE, sending the guards scrambling. BOND takes his position with Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgot to mention: The job comes with a car. 007 begins shooting, as -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill it! Shoot the damn thing - THE GUARDS START BLASTING THE EMPTY MOVING CAR. They mana out the headlights, while - BOND is having trouble coordinating driving and shooting time. As bullets rip up the newspapers in front of them -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. You shoot. I'll drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You know, that's another reason you're probably not in a successful relationship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another reason??? Did I miss something???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking the gun)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You insist on calling all the shots. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And by the way: I am not a helpless girl. Bond eyes her for one split second. Points at the guards:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aim that way. Sidney starts to shoot as - THE GUARDS continue to blast away at the car... But: THE WINDOWS DON'T SHATTER. THE ARMOR-PLATED SIDE-PANELS ONLY DENT WITH BULLET HITS.. THE TIRES DON'T GO FLAT. There's chaos; a cacophony of voices and wild gunfire as THE CAR TO THEIR POSITION, where the door opens automatic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready? Now! The two of them make a break for the car, DIVING INSIDE.

dialogues.speaker: GARAGE -
dialogues.text: - Bond guns the engine, slams the transmission into gear. rubber, GUARDS bounce off the front fenders.

dialogues.speaker: THE GUARDS -
dialogues.text: Continue to shoot at the car.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER GUARDS -
dialogues.text: Run for the HUM-VEES. Hop in and chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond flips open a hidden control panel. Flips a switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TAIL-LIGHTS DROP DOWN and MACHINE GUNS start to fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond glances at the REARVIEW MIRROR. Sees the HUM-VEES. P another switch -

dialogues.speaker: BOND'S EXHAUST PIPE -
dialogues.text: Whoosh! A MISSILE blasts out, trailing smoke as it hones THE FIRST HUM-VEE. BOOM! It's decimated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seal the garage! Cut the power! He's got no headlamps!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the car screeches around a corner, the overhead lights

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond flips down the visor: A THERMAL IMAGING DISPLAY drop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks just like the jet fighter videos from the Gulf W

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond's car roars around a second turn, with sparks flying scrapes the walls. AHEAD, a MASSIVE ONE-PIECE DOOR is FOL FROM THE CEILING. A city street beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not going to make it! Bond flips down a control panel from the RADIO. A DIGITAL begins to run through a set of numbers. Bond explains:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's radio controlled, it'll break the code.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to a button)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We blast through.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY SCREAMS
dialogues.text: BOOM! CRASH! SILENCE. BLACK. After a moment, we HEAR THE FOOTSTEPS ON CEMENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights come on. The car is a twisted wreck, smashed a wall. Bond and Sidney are slumped forward, unconscious. Harmsway KNOCKS TWICE ON THE GARAGE DOOR, to demonstrate:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Built to withstand a nuclear blast. (to Stamper, checking Bond's pulse)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Shall we kill them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I have a better idea. In fact, Mr. Bond may have actually improved my original plan. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring them both to Hong Kong. And Make sure he has nothing else up his sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is early morning in this strange harbor - a place wher restaurant rise out of the fog; where an old Chinese man LA Laker's jersey practices tai-chi on the bow of an anci where sampans cut through the chop filled with ducks, com and women dressed in Chanel 1996, and Beijing 1256... Whi captains of these small water-taxis chatter away on cell- At the end of the harbor, dominating this scene, the CAME

dialogues.speaker: THE FIVE SMOKESTACKS OF THE ABERDEEN HARBOR NUCLEAR POWER
dialogues.text: Panning down this massive dockside facility, the image ch
