dialogues.text: With one important difference: There's an HNN logo in low

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As part of our continuing report on terrorism, we're outside Hong Kong's Aberdeen Harbor nuclear power plant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two VIDEO CAMERAMEN are shooting an ASIAN HNN REPORTER in middle-aged CHINESE MAN. We don't see the reporter's face "over the shoulder" news angle, he's WEARING A HAT. (There's also HNN BELL JETRANGER HELICOPTER on the ground seemingly empty HNN BOAT moored to a nearby pier.) ASIAN MALE NEWS REPORTER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Interviewing Mr. David Chin, senior engineer in charge of security. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, Mr. Chin: How safe is this plant from a terrorist attack? He holds out a MICROPHONE to Chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Totally secure. Without codes, you'd need a missile to blast through the front door; you normally can't even get this close (to the plant) without a full security clearance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Could you say that a little closer to the microphone? He pushes the microphone closer to Chin's face:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. You'd need - Suddenly, A PUFF OF WHITE SMOKE EMERGES FROM THE MICROPHO CHIN COLLAPSES. The HNN reporter TAKES OFF HIS HAT: IT'S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the guards)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now! At once, the two cameramen turn: One AIMS his shoulder-mo camera at a SURVEILLANCE CAMERA; the other aims at the FR BOOM! ROCKETS shoot out from their lenses, destroying bot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go! As Yung and the cameramen rush forward -

dialogues.speaker: THE HNN BOAT -
dialogues.text: Harmsway emerges from the boat accompanied by two men car of equipment. He calls back to TWO MEN who have appeared

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the machine in the water! They begin using a hoist to lift one of the "worms" from (This one looks like an open-mouthed torpedo, with an ant and no flexible tubing attached.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yung and the cameramen turn a corner to the reception/sec

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A generator blew. Nothing to worry about. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I need one last shot of you. Why don't you stand by the alarm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. The guard stands, and smiles, posing for the video camera pulls a pistol from his pocket and shoots him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the cameramen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up the stairs! They follow Yung up a set of stairs leading to the reacto room. Meanwhile, back at the HNN boat:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond is at the porthole, wearing only shorts, trying to f out. He hears the door click open, and - A Guard enters carrying a pile of Bond's clothing with hi top. Stamper is behind him, holding a gun on Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put on your clothes. (to the guard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cuff him. The guard cuffs Bond's hands (in the front,) and we cut b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yung and the Cameramen sweep into the control room: Lots soles, with a window overlooking the REACTOR CORE, and it surrounding blue COOLING POOL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the half-dozen engineers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to interrupt again. But we need one more picture for the story. The engineers ad-lib replies: "Sure." "Okay." Yung smiles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you line up against the wall? Let's make it a group shot. The engineers line up against a wall. The cameramen take for a massacre. And at the first sound of gunfire, we cut

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stamper is marching Bond and Sidney through the door in h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time, I do the driving. Bond gives her a look.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN ON THE CONTROL ROOM -
dialogues.text: Harmsway and Yung are locking down at the VIDEO SCREEN of version of the "worm" controller we saw on the SEA DOLPHI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drill is in the water; approaching the intake tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent. Harmsway looks up, hearing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see you're in your natural element, Harmsway: A room filled with lethal power... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...With a toxic core at its center. Harmsway smiles at Bond and Sidney, who have entered (han gun point,) with Stamper and a guard. Harmsway is charmin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do come in Mr. Bond, Sidney... You're just in time for a nuclear meltdown! Coming closer, Sidney struggles against her cuffs, swingi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bastard - Stamper restrains her, while Bond scans the room for an a He sees a MACHINE PISTOL on the console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Sidney. I'd like to remember you fondly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling from the console)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Approaching the first gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start the grinders.

dialogues.speaker: POWER PLANT INTAKE TUNNEL -
dialogues.text: The "worm" is nearing an iron sluice gate; the eye closes grinders rev, and it starts to eat through the bars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...So that's what the weapons grade uranium was for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precisely, Mr. Bond. In a matter of minutes, the boring device will arrive at the core of the reactor... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when the radioactive blades cut into the plutonium -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Instant melt-down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chernobyl will look like a campfire. Young calls out again, with a hint of urgency. Bond decid rattling Harmsway - so he can move Closer to the gun, unn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're through the first gate. Approaching the second -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (demanding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, Harmsway? Wasn't stealing the gold enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Yung)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bore through. (to Bond, chuckling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...They used to say living well was the best revenge, Mr. Bond. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're wrong. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revenge is the best revenge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Entering the main tunnel - ten minutes to target -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fiercely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What could you possibly have to be vengeful for, Harmsway? Still trying to prove yourself to daddy? This infuriates Harmsway. Bond moves closer to the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hong Kong, Mr. Bond!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to leave -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enraged, ignoring Yung)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred and fifty years ago, my ancestors took this island - a barren, lifeless rock - and turned it into the greatest city known to modern civilization. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now that I'm being forced to give it back, I intend to return it in exactly the same condition: A barren, lifeless rock. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gold is merely reparations - payment from the spineless British government who wouldn't listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sidney, glancing at the gun)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I think Uncle Elliot is having his own melt-down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Approaching the third gate -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smash through it! (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laugh all you'd like, Mr. Bond - but you fit perfectly in to my plans. (he reaches for a newspaper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. This just in. Newsflash. Read all about it. He thrusts an issue of TOMORROW at Bond, holding the top Bond reads THE HEADLINES, sourly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Hong Kong destroyed by nuclear meltdown... British agent found in reactor suspected of sabotage; Harmsway calls for British government to resign. Harmsway smiles at Bond:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...As the advertising says: Tomorrow never lies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the gold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must go. Now. Otherwise the boat won't be out of range - Stamper and the guard appear nervous, itching to leave -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty seconds. (then, to Bond)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the most brilliant part of the plan, Mr. Bond: To save the economy, I'll let the new British government - my British government - announce that the gold was irradiated in Hong Kong - where no one will be able to touch it for a hundred years. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And just by coincidence: He turns the paper over and reads/reveals a smaller headl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Gold mine opens in Vietnam. (turns to Stamper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. Put them in the airlock. Stamper moves towards Bond and Sidney. Bond edges closer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll never get away with it, Harmsway. Too many people know. Bond tenses, ready to spring -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who, Mr. Bond? The kooks - the crazies - the conspiracy theorists? The Oliver Stones of the world? (pausing, then, with great scorn:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll publish their books, I'll make their movies, I'll put them on my TV shows! (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're my bellboys. They carry my luggage. Bond moves, but - the guard picks up the gun!!! Bond frow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now. Get them in the airlock. Fortunately, Bond has a back-up plan. As Stamper hustles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One problem, Harmsway: The girl. And the handcuffs. They'll give it away. Harmsway considers this for a second. Sidney takes Bond's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I want to stay with him. Bond looks at her. He's surprised: In the blink of an eye realizes he's developed feelings for her. He knows that i hold her, he'd kiss her, and whisper "You're a hell of a But at the same instant - throwing a glance at Yung - he running out of time against the worm, and is better off a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breaking the moment, cynically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (satto, to Bond)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My timing always was lousy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cold and hard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd rather die alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the girl. Leave the handcuffs. We'll drown her at sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bond, sarcastically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjoy the rest of your life. As Stamper pushes Bond into the reactor room airlock, he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll meet you on the boat, south of Lantau Island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door closes. Bond looks out the small window at:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the men. I can finish alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the technicians and cameramen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come with me - (to the guard who handcuffed Bond)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stay here. As they exit -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond has yanked his shoes off. He pulls out the PLASTIQUE SHOELACES and opens the SECRET COMPARTMENT IN HIS HEEL, r DETONATOR, and EAR PLUGS. Moving quickly, Bond BITES OFF a 2-inch piece of shoelace it around the chain-link connecting his handcuffs, while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yung sits down at the worm control and explains to the gu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll cut through the last gate, then set it on auto-pilot. He starts to maneuver the joystick, and -

dialogues.speaker: INTAKE TUNNEL -
dialogues.text: The worm turns a corner. We see -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 100 feet ahead: An iron gate. Beyond it, the blue lights reactor cooling pool... And beyond that... THE REACTOR CO shimmering silver target. Meanwhile, back outside, at -

dialogues.speaker: THE DOCK -
dialogues.text: Water sprays violently as the HNN boat thunders out of Ab harbor with Harmsway at the helm. Junks and sampans are t his wake, as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond finishes pressing the SHOELACES AROUND THE DOOR LOCK TURNS UP HIS SHIRT COLLAR TO PULL OUT A WIRE that's been inside. He connects it between the explosive on the handcuff chai detonator, then steals a glance out the window at:

dialogues.speaker: YUNG -
dialogues.text: still guiding the worm with the joy stick. His eyes are f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Yung sees the gate looming ahead on the video scree presses a nearby button marked "START GRINDERS"... And th goes black, replaced by the words "GRINDERS ENGAGED."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The worm bares its lethal teeth; and revs up to speed. Me

dialogues.speaker: BOND -
dialogues.text: Closes his eyes, presses the detonator, and -

dialogues.speaker: YUNG -
dialogues.text: HEARS a small BOOM from inside the airlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the guard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check it out. Be careful. The guard picks up his machine pistol, starts to the door

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE AIRLOCK -
dialogues.text: Bond (with his hands now free) is quickly rewiring the de the plastique explosive around the door handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The worm's teeth are beginning to cut into the steel bars THE GUARD APPROACHES THE DOOR. BOND BRACES HIMSELF INSIDE THE AIRLOCK.

dialogues.speaker: THE GUARD PEERS INTO THE WINDOW -
dialogues.text: And suddenly... BOOM! The door blows open with a shatteri

dialogues.speaker: THE CONTROL ROOM -
dialogues.text: The guard is blasted backward, dead. Bond rolls out, scra the weapon. Yung slams his hand on a button marked "AUTO- caption appears on the video screen "TARGET LOCKED," and As Bond grabs the gun, bringing it up to shoot, Yung dive him. They struggle, and the gun skitters across the floor the window overlooking the blue cooling pool. Breaking free, Bond moves around a console for the gun. Y shortcut - leaping on, and then over the console, as -

dialogues.speaker: THE WORM, (UNDERWATER - INTAKE TUNNEL)
dialogues.text: Chews through the last of the iron bars, and glides throu toward THE SILVERY REACTOR CORE, 35 feet ahead.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND YUNG -
dialogues.text: have squared off in a short, brutal MARTIAL ARTS battle. (The fight takes place in the space between the consoles reactor core window; the gun, lies on the ground between They trade punch after punch - and although Bond is holdi Yung is every bit his equal. Backing off, Bond spins into a crescent kick - But Yung catches Bond's foot, and shoves Bond backwards, against a wall near a FIRE EXTINGUISHER. Meanwhile, all through this... THE WORM IS GETTING CLOSER TO THE CORE.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN ON BOND AND YUNG -
dialogues.text: As Yung reaches down for the gun, Bond grabs the fire ext from the wall. He rushes Yung, blasting him with CO2. In the white smoke, Yung drops the gun... Then CHARGES at headbutting him, twisting, and turning 007... SMASHING BO BACKWARDS AGAINST THE GLASS WINDOW. THE WINDOW SHATTERS. Bond is winded. And as he struggles himself from falling backwards into the reactor room... Yung does a FLYING, FEET FIRST KICK to finish the job - But at the last second, BOND DUCKS, reaches up, and uses momentum to send him flying over Bond's head into - THE REACTOR ROOM. He sails through the air, heading for the cooling pool 20 THE WORM CLOSES IN ON THE SILVER REACTOR CORE.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN ON THE CONTROL ROOM -
dialogues.text: Bond races to hit the "EMERGENCY REACTOR SHUT DOWN" butto a FIRE ALARM, disconnects the worm, and sets off an "EMER DECONTAMINATION" system, spraying the room with a mist of Finally, Bond retrieves the gun, and pauses to look down

dialogues.speaker: THE REACTOR POOL, (BOND'S POV)
dialogues.text: There's a cloud of RED in the middle of the blue water.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN TO SCENE -
dialogues.text: Bond goes to the dead guard. Gets the key, removes his ha bracelets, then hoists the dead guard over his shoulder,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the sound of fire engines approaching in the backgro straps the dead guard into the passenger seat, and takes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HNN boat has pulled alongside the Sea Dolphin II. The the nuke plant is boarding the larger boat. (Note: From the air, we should notice that the "gold hold covered by a steel hatch, and the biggest worm is stored hanging from a steel boom.)

dialogues.speaker: THE DECK -
dialogues.text: Coming up the ladder first, Harmsway is greeted by the Ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any news?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The call just went out on the Hong Kong police radio: Fire at the power plant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ironically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alert the media! Stamper and Sidney have climbed onto the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do with her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Can't we make a deal? I won't say anything -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touching her cheek)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so cute, my dear. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm afraid not. (to one of the cameramen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put her in the storage room. The cameraman takes her away. Harmsway turns to the capta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get rid of her when we're in International waters. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set sail, full speed, due south. I'll be in my cabin. Let me know when Mr. Yung arrives. We'll break out the champagne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Near the engine room (indicating we're near the bottom of the cameraman opens a door to a small, cramped room with SCUBA EQUIPMENT. He pushes Sidney inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get any ideas. Then locks the door on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several hundred feet in the air, the helicopter is headin island in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond checks the compass, and adjusts his course. The COMP DUE SOUTH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter clears the island: Bright blue sea ahead. then passes over - the HNN boat, bobbing empty in the wat Then, further ahead, he spots the stern of Sea Dolphin II in the instance.

dialogues.speaker: REAR DECK
dialogues.text: Looking north, off the back of the boat Stamper and a cre helicopter - a tiny speck in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There it is. Stamper lifts a pair of BINOCULARS for confirmation.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE BINOCULARS -
dialogues.text: He sees two figures in the cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN TO SCENE -
dialogues.text: Stamper picks up his radio:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's him. They both made it.

dialogues.speaker: THE BRIDGE -
dialogues.text: The Captain replies:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell Sir Elliot.

dialogues.speaker: HARMSWAY'S CABIN -
dialogues.text: Harmsway is working at a computer. A chime sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's approaching from the north, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fantastic. Invite the crew on deck to celebrate, and I'll be up in a few minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond is about two miles out from the stern of the Sea Dol Maybe 500' in the air. Taking the machine pistol from the dead guard's lap, he o small pilot's window, and balances it on his knees. Ahead

dialogues.speaker: DECK
dialogues.text: The crewmen are lining up on either side of the landing p ship's railings.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN ON BOND -
dialogues.text: Ready for war. He pushes the cyclic pitch lever forward, Bell Jetranger goes into a screaming descent.

dialogues.speaker: THE DECK/HELICOPTER LANDING PAD
dialogues.text: Champagne bottles pop. Stamper is with a crewman, who loo the chopper, about 1000' off the stern:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He seems to be coming in awfully fast. Stamper picks up his binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE BINOCULARS -
dialogues.text: He sees Bond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the guns! It's not him! It's Bond!!! He might have also added "It's too late," as -

dialogues.speaker: REAR DECK OF THE BOAT/HELICOPTER -
dialogues.text: Bond SWOOPS IN LOW on the port side of the boat, FIRING H the pilot's window, and using the CHOPPER'S BLADES to thr men on deck. About half of them DIVE INTO THE WATER FOR SAFETY, only t left behind. Flying up the port side toward the front of the boat, Bon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The windows rattle as Bond's chopper thunders by. Perplex Harmsway stands, opens the porthole curtains. He cranes h but sees nothing. He presses an intercom button:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on a phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know sir - The helicopter suddenly appears in front of him. Shooting pilot's window, Bond shatters the glass windows - And the Captain slumps forward on the wheel, spinning it to the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boat pitches wildly; Harmsway looses his balance, cra wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney is thrown from her bench, slamming against scuba t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stamper bounces himself, handing out AUTOMATIC WEAPONS fr cache hidden inside a DINGHY. The two cameramen take their M-16's and rush forward, jum some machinery to climb onto -

dialogues.speaker: THE ROOF OF THE BRIDGE -
dialogues.text: They rush forward, and assume positions shooting at Bond.

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER -
dialogues.text: Taking hits. Bond pivots and turns the chopper, heading s them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men turn, and start to run as the chopper chases them

dialogues.speaker: BOND HOOKS BOTH OF THEM WITH THE SKIDS, BY THE BACK OF TH
dialogues.text: SHIRTS!!!!   The man are flailing like crazy as -

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER REARS BACKWARDS, AND UP -
dialogues.text: And the men burst through their shirt buttons, FALLING, S into the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond pushes the cyclic sideways to bank down, and in, on But he doesn't see -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SMALL ROCKET STREAKING UPWARD from the boat. Stamper is shoulder mounted launcher.

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER -
dialogues.text: BOOM! It hits the engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gauges go crazy; the alarms go berserk. The entire co chattering as Bond struggles to remain in control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARMSWAY is trying to make his way up the ladder as the b continues to veer out of control. He pauses to look up at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond forces the cyclic forward. The helicopter pitches fo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's heading straight for the hatch covering the gold hol is left alive is diving off the ship to get out of the wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Struggling with the wheel, Harmsway picks up the radio:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Bond!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill him! Finish it!

dialogues.speaker: STAMPER, (EXT. MID-SHIP)
dialogues.text: With the worm dangling from a boom in the background, he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the chopper about 15 feet above the gold hold - just under control - Bond opens the door. He leaps out onto the hatch, and rolls off, disappearing THE CHOPPER CRASHES onto the gold hold, in a GIANT BALL O twisted metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney looks up, hearing and feeling the explosion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harmsway regains control of the boat; he TAKES A GUN from captain, and pushes the body out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With FLAMING DEBRIS still falling around him, Bond is ste moving down a passageway toward the front of the ship. (Bond has two goals in mind at this point: First, to neut threats, and second, to save Sidney if she's still alive. Arriving at a BULKHEAD DOOR, Bond checks both directions passageway, then pokes his head inside - And is SUDDENLY YANKED BACKWARDS, OUT INTO THE PASSAGEWAY against a railing. Bond looks up: STAMPER stands with a smile on his face. One arm is raise head, grasping the WORM on the swinging boom. The worm is to the boom by a thin metal cable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're mine now. Bond rushes at Stamper, slamming into him. The man doesn' With his free hand, he grabs Bond by his shirt, and throw against a steel wall. Bond crashes to the deck. As Bond recovers, Stamper (still smiling) presses a RED B wall, and THE WORM comes to life. Stamper closes in on Bond with the worm. Bond tries to stand, but Stamper flings him back down, pi against the wall with his free hand as he - MANEUVERS THE WORM TOWARDS BOND'S HEAD. With the cutting blades whirring inches away from Bond's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to do this slowly - Bond executes a scissor kick to Stamper's ankles. Stamper sideways. Bond rolls away from the worm - But by the time Bond gets to his feet, Stamper has recove rushing at Bond full force, with the worm. Stamper thrusts the worm at Bond once. Bond ducks. The wo into the wall. Pulling the device back, Stamper thrusts a second time - action,) then a third (same action) - still missing Bond.

dialogues.speaker: CLOSE ON THE CABLE SPOOL/CABLE -
dialogues.text: With all the yanking and pulling, a loop of slack has dev the cable, on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN TO SCENE -
dialogues.text: Stamper is about to attack Bond a fourth time when Bond k the groin. Stamper doubles over in pain - And the worm FLIES OUT OF HIS HAND, swinging on the boom SIDE OF THE SHIP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grinders propel the worm forward, into the hull.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY
dialogues.text: Hears a strange vibrating sound from the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barking into the radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stamper! Report in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Stamper straightens up, winded from the groin kick -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing, on Stamper's radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Report to the bridge! BOND rushes to A SMALL PILE OF SLACK CABLE, which is rapi taught as the worm wends its way underwater. Stamper rushes Bond - And in one lightening fast move, Bond wraps the cable twi Stamper's neck. Suddenly THE CABLE TIGHTENS, and - STAMPER soars 15 in the air, HANGING BY HIS NECK, as -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE WORM BURSTS THROUGH THE WALL! A torrent of water floo pushing Sidney off to one side.

dialogues.speaker: INT. STORAGE CABIN -
dialogues.text: It's zooming at the door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door bursts open, sending tons of water into the pass

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boat shudders violently, sending Harmsway crashing ag wall, cutting his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the boat rocks, Bond steadies himself, then starts for using the same route as the cameramen lifted by the chopp First climbing up on some machinery, then up onto the bri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney is thrashing for air, with only a few inches left rising water and the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3/4 filled with water. Rising fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The worm is heading for a door. We see the door disintegr front of us, as the worm bursts into - THE ENGINE ROOM. With the water cascading over the camera, (as if we were inside an ocean wave,) the worm heads for a tank marked "

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boat is sinking. Bond is running across the bridge ro THE BOAT SUDDENLY LISTS TO THE STARBOARD SIDE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harmsway is thrown backwards. Gun in hand, he makes his w incline, to the port-side door. Just when he thinks he's made it - Bang. Bond appears in the doorway, having jumped down fro on the small exterior walkway. He's seething with rage. Harmsway looks up at him. Blinks in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never believe what I read in the newspapers. Harmsway slowly brings up the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pity you'll miss your obituary. Bond smacks the gun out of his hand with contempt. Moves

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she, Harmsway? BOOM! The fuel tanks explode in the distance. The bridge violently; the room tilts to a greater angle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to kill me, Bond? Go ahead. With both arms, Bond pushes Harmsway backwards, flinging against the starboard wall. The water is rising on the br

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving in on him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she Harmsway? - He grabs Harmsway by the lapels, and throws him against t wall, crashing onto the instrument panel head first. Harmsway laughs maniacally, face down on the gauges:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, Bond? You haven't the guts? Boom! There's another explosion in the background! The fr boat tilts upward! The water is rushing in! Bond grabs Harmsway by the shoulder -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You spineless paper tiger - And yanks him off the instrument panel, flinging him back against the rear wall of the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she, Harmsway?!? Or did you kill her like Paris? Suddenly, THE BOAT GROANS. The BRIDGE RISES OUT OF THE WA BOND loses his balance, FALLING ONTO HARMSWAY -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glaring, insanely:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all go down together!!! Harmsway lunges for Bond's throat -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Bond breaks Harmsway's grasp in a violent struggle punches him. Air bubbles break from Harmsway's mouth. He frantically tries to break free for the surface - But Bond pulls him back down, and holds him down, pushing Harmsway's shoulders. Harmsway is thrashing about, flailing in all directions, Bond in a haze of bubbles... Then falls still. With his lungs aching, bursting with fire, Bond rockets u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: through the bridge windows, up to - THE SURFACE. He breaks through the water, gasping for air... And then, instantly, dives down again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond dives for the boat - down, and down, chasing it, as just grab it, and stop it from sinking. He goes deeper, and deeper, as it sinks further and furth just beyond his reach. And just when it seems impossible for him to survive - to breath a second longer - A FIGURE IN SCUBA GEAR (mask and tank) GRABS HIM. Bond turns in disbelief. Stares into the mask: IT'S SIDNE puts her regulator in Bond's mouth... And they share the air as they rise from the depths.

dialogues.speaker: THE SURFACE -
dialogues.text: They break through the water. Sidney yanks off her mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, you'd rather die alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say when I want to die - She splashes him. Turning away, Bond spots Stamper's 'arm dinghy floating nearby.

dialogues.speaker: THE DINGHY -
dialogues.text: Bond climbs into it, then helps Sidney get in. They colla bottom of the boat, resting their heads against the gunwa After a beat, SIDNEY CLEARS HER THROAT. Bond is already a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before we go any further here, Mr. Bond, from Lloyds of London, I just want to get two things straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First, that boat is in international waters. I'm claiming it for salvage. One-third of that gold is mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And number two?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you think we're going to have some kind of 'life affirming' romance here just because we cheated death, let me be clear: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to have it where I want, and when I want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when might that be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now. He laughs. She falls into his arms. They kiss, and we cut

dialogues.speaker: TWO PAIRS OF BINOCULARS -
dialogues.text: With the dinghy reflected in the glass. In unison, they a lowered, revealing Q and Wade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... As usual, I see the situation is in 007's very capable hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life is not fair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emphatically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. A British naval officer appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Major Boothroyd - the message went to London.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Q and Wade throw a glance back to the sea, then turn, wak

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, Q-ster. You do ever do any gardening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The only thing I ever planted was bugs.

dialogues.speaker: A PICTURE OF HARMSWAY ON A VIDEO SCREEN -
dialogues.text: On the wall behind M's DESK. It's night. Moneypenny sits from M, with a steno pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moneypenny, take the following release: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The body of Sir Elliot Harmsway was found floating in the South China Sea this morning, at 08:00 hours local Hong Kong time. (pauses)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At present, local authorities believe the media mogul committed suicide.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN ON THE DINGHY -
dialogues.text: Bond and Sidney break off a kiss. She lies nestled in his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James... Is this really what a typical day is like for you? Bond replies with a wry smile:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But some days... Are longer than others. And with this, he reaches up over his head, and pulls a t two of them... And the camera pulls back, and up, rising into the air to The entire British Navy closing in on them from all point compass.
